Lydia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, and also sewing supplies. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, and sewing supplies

loans.name: José Victor

texts.es:
José Victor es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, limón y maracuyá. La zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero en una de las plantas procesadoras de mango que se encuentra situada  cerca a la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja junto a su esposa en un negocio de venta de ropa, para lo cual tiene un pequeño establecimiento en su negocio. Ellos ofrecen su mercadería en venta a los vecinos de la zona en donde reside y los ingresos que perciben de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Esta es una actividad bastante importante para su sostenimiento por lo que siempre tratan de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

José desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más prendas de vestir de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Victor is a 24-year-old family man who lives with his wife and their three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a zone that mostly grows fruits like mangos, lemons and passion fruit. The zone is part of the Piura region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
He works at one of the mango processing plants located near the zone where he lives. He and his wife also run a clothing business, for which they have a small establishment in their home. They offer their merchandise for sale to their neighbours and the revenue is used to improve the family’s financial situation. This business is a fairly important source of income for the family, which is why they try to keep it running in the best way possible.
José would like to expand his business by acquiring more clothing such that he can increase his sales and take in more revenue. This is why he has requested an 800 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to expand his business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in a business of selling clothes. She is 35 years old, married to an NGO worker with one child. Stella hopes to increase her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three small businesses: aquaculture, tailoring and raising livestock. Her husband, Hernanie E., who is 60 years old, works as a laborer. They have four children who range in age from 26 to 34. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because wanted a better life for her family. With the help of her 14 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been achieving this goal. Her most recent loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000 and meant improvements to her family's life. She is applying for a new loan, her 15th, for PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to expand her aquaculture business and thereby help pay for her children's education and for home repairs. Virginia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a small aquaculture business

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman who lives in Compostela, Cebu. She operates 2 business ventures:  abaca weaving and a general store. Her husband, Ronelo, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children aged between 16 and 25.

Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her abaca weaving business. In that way she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and home repairs. Annabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Saidmurtazo

texts.ru: Сафоев Саидмуртазо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Саидмуртазо имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. Он предоставляет услугу, занимается перевозкой. У него имеется трактор и грузовой автомобиль. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Saidmurtazo S. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saidmurtazo has a secondary-specialized education as a driver.  He provides a transportation service.  He has a tractor and a heavy-duty truck.  Saidmurtazo has a lot of experience in this business.  He is requesting this loan for car repairs.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr: Clémentine D. est élévatrice du porc dans le district du Rubavu.  Elle est mariée, et elle a 2 enfants entre 2 ans et 5 ans, un de qui va a l’école, et une personne en charge.  Clémentine a un niveau d’éducation d’A2 en Pédagogie, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des bétails (porc) pour en élever, et construire leur ferme.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de suivre de près la sante de ses bétails, augmenter le nombre des bétails à élever, protéger-les contre les maladies, et les nourrir bien.  Elle voudrait élever le nombre d’élevage, tirer une source de revenu suffisant dans ce projet, et l’autofinancement de ce projet.  Pour sa famille et sa vie, elle voudrait scolariser tous ses enfants, continuer ses études, et améliorer l’habitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Clémentine D. raises pigs in the Rubavu district. She is married and has two children (a two-year-old and a five-year-old; one of them goes to school) and a dependent. Clémentine is educated to the A2 level in pedagogy; this credit is her first cycle with ABC. She will use her loan to purchase livestock (pigs), to raise it, and to build up her farm. Her strategy for the growth of the business is to closely monitor her livestock's health, to increase the number of pigs to raise, to protect them against diseases, and to feed them well. She would like to increase the number of pigs she raises, derive sufficient income from this project, and to reach self-financing. As far as her family and life are concerned, she would like to send all her children to school, pursue her studies, and improve her family's housing.

loans.use: To purchase livestock (pigs) to raise and to build up their farm

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is 45 years old, married and has three children, the oldest of which is 18. She makes a living as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato, growing rice that she sells to people in her community. She works hard because she is committed to provide her each of her children with a good education and a bright future. She has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Lorena Vive en la localidad de el torno es nacida en el departamento de Santa Cruz, es de ocupación comerciante de productos de belleza cosmeticos y también trabaja como secretaria en el colegio de la localidad del mismo municipio, su esposo es empleado en una empresa, tienen un hijo, pequeño el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción,  para la  construcción de un kiosco, en su domicilio, son clientes antiguos en la institución, por lo que se sienten agradecidos por el apoyo que se le a brindado. La Sra. Lorena es una pesona responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, con muchas ganas de superacion con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorena lives in the town of El Torno, but she was born in the Department of Santa Cruz. Her occupation is that of a merchant who sells beauty products and cosmetics. She also works as a secretary for a local school in the same town where she lives. Her husband is a company employee and they have a young child.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for building a kiosk in her home. Lorena and her husband are long-time clients of Emprender and express their appreciation for the support that has been given to them. Sra. Lorena is a responsible and hardworking individual who is always thinking about the welfare of her family. With great desire to succeed, she wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for building a sales kiosk.

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda A. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Lecilda is married and has five school-age children. Lecilda owns and operates a food stall, selling snacks and other delicacies, like bread, rice cakes, pudding, and cups of coffee and milk, in the local community. Lecilda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Lecilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lecilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients for rice cakes. Lecilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bread, flour, milk, and coffee. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lecilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bread, flour, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Foli Mawulolo

texts.fr: Jeune homme marié de 35 ans, Foli et sa femme sont tous les deux agents commercial des produits ‘’FOREVER ‘’.ils sont  parents de 03 enfants.il  revend de manière ambulante  ces produits. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2008 et s’approvisionne au siège de’’ FOREVER LEAVING PRODUCT’’ .il sollicite ce premier crédit  dans notre institution pour acheter un vidéo projecteur et un portable pour pouvoir mieux parler de ses produits à ses clients et favoriser la vente car plusieurs personnes s’intéressent à la chose mais aimerait voir des reportages des clients qui en parlent .Ce qui lui faciliterait les ventes et majorer son revenu  mensuel .
texts.en:
A young married man of 35, Foli and his wife are both sales representatives for "Forever" products. They have three children. They sell these products as itinerant vendors; they began in 2008, and they get their supplies at the "Forever Leaving Product" headquarters.

They are seeking their first loan in order to purchase a video projector and a laptop computer. They will be able to make a better presentation of their products to their customers and make more sales, as many people are interested but would like to see testimonials from customers. This would make selling easier and increase their monthly revenue.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a video projector

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with 4 children. Regina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Regina is a farmer and plants and harvest rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. 
Regina has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Moussodjeton  3 Group

texts.fr:
MOUSSODJETON 3  est un regroupement  de six femmes mariées du village de DJALAKORO  de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et au moins 3 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel  de ADA, qui est la présidente du groupe et qui est la première debout à gauche avec une écharpe bleu,  sera utilisé pour acheter, de la semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 17000 à 70000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et  les  dépenses  courantes  de la famille.
texts.en: MOUSSODJETON 3 is a group of six married women from the village of DJALAKORO in the SAN region of SÉGOU, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali.  They live in traditional families.  Their average age is 29 and they have an average of at least 3 children.  They cultivate peanuts.  With the goal of making their agricultural business profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago.  After fully repaying their prior loans, they are on their third loan. The current loan for ADA, who is the president of the group and the first person standing on the left with the blue scarf, will be used to buy peanut seeds, small equipment, and inputs for cultivation, at the main market in SAN.  After the rainy season, the harvest is stored for a certain time so that it has value, before being sold at the main market of SAN and at other nearby markets, at retail (often at wholesale), in cash, to customers who usually come from large cities.  The members of the group expect to each make, after the distribution and sale of their agricultural products, a profit of 17000 to 70000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, seeds, and small equipment.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years she has operated a water-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells clothes and real estate, which provide additional sources of income. The major challenge her water-selling business faces is seasonality. During the rainy season she experiences low sales volume, while during the hot dry season she experiences a high number of sales.

With the KES 20,000 she wishes to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  Fatuma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family.  She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Elsie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

Elsie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El señor Severiano de 43 años de edad, es esposo de la señora  Mirta de 46 años de edad, ellos tienen 3 hijos.
Severiano se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería y bazar, esta actividad lo realiza hace más de 15 años. La venta lo realiza en varias ciudades. Él recorre sin móvil, viaja en ómnibus, y recorre tiendas y librerías ofreciendo sus mercaderías como peluches, chiches para escritorio, flores, floreros y otros.
Manifiesta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pues implica un gran esfuerzo salir a recorres y tratar d vender sus mercaderías, pero dice que todo esfuerzo es poco por brindarle a su familia lo mejor.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de regalos o presentes, pues se acerca el día de la amistad y tiene muchos pedidos para esa fecha. El agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Señor Severiano is 43 years old and is the husband of Señora Mirta who is 46.  They have 3 children.  Severiano has been selling bazaar merchandise and trinkets for more than 15 years.  He makes his sales in various cities.  He travels by bus selling merchandise such as stuffed animals, desktop toys, flowers, vases, and more to stores and book stores.  He says that his job requires a lot of sacrifices because it takes a lot of effort to travel and try to sell his merchandise.  He also says that all his effort is small because he can give his family the best. 

He is requesting a loan to buy gifts items as Friendship Day is getting close and he has many orders for this date.  He is grateful to Fundación for the opportunity that they have given him.

loans.use: purchase gift items to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее одна дочка – Дарина. Оксана – рыночный предприниматель из Белой Церкви. Она продает сладости и выпечку на местном центральном рынке. У нее всегда огромный ассортимент конфет, печенья, шоколада и все всегда свежее. Торговая точка находится в оживленном месте. Оксана выкупила этот торговый киоск совсем недавно, а до этого были большие затраты на аренду. В торговле Оксана уже 8 лет. Ее чистая прибыль составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Оксане нужен кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы еще больше разнообразить ассортимент товара и увеличить свой доход. Это поможет вложить полученные от бизнеса средства в благоустройство квартиры, а, значит, поможет и существенно повысить свои жилищные условия и образ жизни. Оксане нравится заниматься этим видом торговли, ведь она раньше работала именно в этой сфере и уже была знакома с делом. Оксана уравновешенная, спокойная, вежливая и трудолюбивая. Ее бизнес стабилен и перспективен. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oksana is married. She has one daughter, Darina. Oksana is a market trader from  Belaya Tserkov. She sells sweets and pastries at the local central market. She always has a huge range of sweets, cookies, and chocolates, and everything is always fresh. This shop is located in a busy place. Oksana bought this shop recently, and before that she paid a high price to rent. Oksana has been in trade for eight years.  Her net profit is about 5,000 hryvnia. 

Oksana needs a loan for 7,000 hryvnia to further diversify her products and increase her income. Then, she can take the money she makes in the business and use it to improve her apartment, and, therefore, will help significantly improve her living conditions and lifestyle. Oksana likes to do this kind of trading, because she used to this work and is familiar with it. Oksana is laid-back, calm, polite, and hardworking. Her business is stable and promising.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 31 years old. She is married and has one infant-aged child. She has been operating a livestock business for the past six years, making a monthly profit of PHP 2,000. She is borrowing PHP 4,000 with which she plans to purchase more livestock (four pigs) for sale. 

With the anticipated profit, she plans to establish a piggery. In the future, she hopes to have a big piggery farm and to be selling meat to the town market.

In the future, Cheryll hopes that her business expands so they can build their own house.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: Afepeb Gbegamey Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AFEPEB GBEGAMEY est composé de quatorze membres qui se connaissent parce qu’elles habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Clémence Suzanne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Clémence Suzanne est mariée à un électricien nommé Augustin et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Clémence Suzanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Clémence Suzanne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Clémence Suzanne mène comme activité depuis quinze ans environs, la vente de bouillie de maïs accompagné de gâteaux (faits à base de farine de blé) à son domicile. Clémence Suzanne s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Clémence Suzanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AFEPEB GBEGAMEY, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The “Afepeb Gbegamey” group is composed of 14 members who know each other  frpm living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, by the name of Clémence Suzanne, is the one raising her hand in the photo. With the goal of expanding  their business activities and better meeting demand, the group is seeking a financing from ALIDé. Clémence Suzanne is married to Augustin, an electrician, and has three children, all of whom are in school. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs.  Clémence Suzanne lives together with her husband and children. She never went to school. In order to provide for herself and her family, for about the last 15 years Clémence Suzanne has been selling corn porridge  as well as wheat flour by cakes  out of her home. Clémence Suzanne stocks up in Benin. In order to bolster her business and better meet her customers’ needs, Clémence Suzanne, together with other members of the “Afepeb Gbegamey” group, is seeking a loan from ALIDé. They goal is to expand their business activities.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour,  corn and sugar

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro tiene la edad de 58 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, se encuentra casado, el  su familia viven en una comunidad  que se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una una zona cañera.

Don Alejandro nos platica que decidio iniciar su negocio debido a la situacion economica que se vive en su comunidad ya que cada vez hay menos empleo y todo aumenta de precio, el para apoyar con los gastos del hogar de su familia decidio desde hace 16 años crear su propia Miselandia (tienda de abarrotes) asi a podido tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Don Alejandro realizas sus ventas desde su casael tiene un local en el cual ha 
puesto su Miselandia le dio el nombe de "Vicky" porque asi se llama su esposas, el ofrece a sus clientes venta de hilos y listones, abarrotes, dulces, refrescos, y papeleria , tambien nos dice que en un futuro le gustaria tambien vender un poco de frutas y verduras, asi hacer que el negcio creesca

El necesita este credito para la compra de galletas, refrescos, productos de papeleria, productos enlatados, dulces, frijol, azucar, servilletas, productos desechables y productos de mercerias (hilos, ganchos, estambres y agujas) y posteriormente ponerlos a la venta en su pequeño negocio.

Don Alejandro espera que con este credito su negocio cresca un poco mas y que poderlos dale una mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro is 58 years old and studied until secondary school. He is married and lives with his family in a community characterized as being in a sugar cane area.

He tells us that he decided to start his business due to the economic situation of his community, since there are increasingly fewer jobs and everything is going up in price. In order to pay for his family’s household expenses, he decided to start his own variety or grocery store 16 years ago so that he could have a better quality of life.

Alejandro makes sales from his home, since he has a space there where he has installed his variety store, which he named “Vicky” after his wife. He offers his customers, ribbons and thread, groceries, sweets, soft drinks, stationary. He tells us that in the future he would also like to sell a few fruits and vegetables and thus expand his business.

He needs this loan to buy cookies, soft drinks, stationary, tinned goods, sweets, beans, sugar, napkins, perishables, dry-goods (thread, hooks, yarn, and needles) and later sell them in his small business.

Alejandro hopes that with this loan his business will grow a little more and that he will be able to provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Saerahon's Group

texts.en:
Saerahon is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a construction worker, who works in Russia. She brings up a son and two daughters. The son studies at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn a livelihood, Saerahon breeds livestock and resells them at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns about 4,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, Saerahon wants to increase the number of livestock. She plans to purchase three sheep for breeding, fattening and reselling. 

In the future, she is going to start building a shed to keep livestock there.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 25-year-old man. He has a store where he sells toys and stationary. He wants to improve his sales by purchasing more stock and wants to improve his store by purchasing more shelves and putting in more lights. He does not have enough money to pay for this so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yasser gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more stock so he will have a better selection of goods for sale which will enable him to compete and increase his income. He will also improve his store by purchasing more shelves and enhancing store lighting.Yasser is photographed in his store. 


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more stationary and toys, shelves and lights to improve the store

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en: Cassien was born in 1976. He is married and has three children who are between 6 and 8 years old. All of his children attend school. Cassien sells different products such as ones from poultry, food items such as bananas, beans, and vegetables. He will use the loan to increase his inventory. With the profits, he will expand his poultry business. Cassien dreams to get more than four million in income in the future.

loans.use: To expand his poultry business by purchasing more inventory

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta de 41 años de edad, vive muy cerca al mar con sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 20 años; allí tiene el negocio de vender mercancías,  mediante guías especializada de productos, el cual  inició hace 3 años cuando decidió genera ingresos a través de la comercialización de unas cuantas mercancías  a una clientela domestica;  gradualmente fue creciendo y a sus jeans, calzados, y ropa, agregó productos ofrecidos  mediante catálogos, como cosméticos, colonias perfumes, accesorios etc. Las mercancias que vende Julieta las distribuye para que sus clientes las paguen en dos partes, su rotación de inventarios es de 31 dias y su marge de utilidad promedia es no menor del 30%. En la actualidad esta aplicado a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitando un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía variada que tiene en su catálogo en ofertas,  y de las cuales sus clientes han hecho pedidos; Con este financiamiento Julieta,  se está preparando para finalizar el año con un importante volumen de ventas,  debido a que esta es la época de mayor repunte comercial. Su meta más adelante es tener un almacén de variedades bien posicionado en pleno centro de Puerto Colombia, municipio donde habita.
texts.en:
Julieta, 41, lives very close to the ocean with her two children who are 14 and 20 years old.  She has her business there selling merchandise via catalogue.  She started it three years ago when she decided to earn income selling some merchandise to a domestic clientele.  Gradually she grew and to her jeans, footwear and clothing she added catalogue merchandise like cosmetics, colognes, perfumes, accessories, etc.  The merchandise that Julieta sells is paid back to her in two installments by her customers.  Her stock turnover rate is 31 days and her average profit margin is no less than 30%.

She is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’s asking for a Kiva loan to buy assorted merchandise from her catalogues that is on special promotion and which her customers have ordered from her.  With this financing, Julieta is preparing for the end of the year with an important spike in sales because this is the season of highest sales.  Her goal for later on is to have a well-situated variety store right in downtown Puerto Colombia, the town where she lives.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza, age 43, owns a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. Maria Liza and her husband have six children.
  
Maria Liza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 51-year-old woman. She has one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ngoc and her husband have been earning a living by running a food stall and a general store for 11 years. 

Ngoc is asking for a loan to buy a range of basic goods such as rice, soft drinks, milk and sugar to stock her general store and sell from her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a range of basic goods such as rice, soft drinks, milk and sugar to stock her general store and sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 34 years-old, married and has two children ages 14 and seven.  In 1995, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  

She thanks you for your support.

-----------------------------------------

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married with 4 children. Andresa is 52 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Andresa has a dried fish retail business to earn a living.  She has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 2000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 13000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Andresa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es:
Esther tiene un negocio de papelería. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con el negocio ya que se levanta desde las 07h00 a tenderlo. Su abuela en ocasiones también le ayuda en la atención vende papelería de todo tipo y algunas prendas de vestir. 

En el futuro quiere continuar apoyando a su familia con el negocio por eso quiere ahora comprar con el préstamo ropa para tener mas variedad para los clientes.
texts.en:
Esther is an entrepreneurial young woman whose mother taught her when she was very young to run their stationary store. She lives outside the city and works together with her mother to generate income for their family.

She has many hopes for the future. This is why she wants to keep working at the store and why she gets up early in the morning to go work there. Her grandmother also helps her out from time to time selling a wide variety of stationary and a few items of clothing.

In the future, she would like to continue supporting her family by working at the store. This is why she wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing in order to offer their customers a greater variety.

loans.use: ropa

loans.name: Neuz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Neuz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Alberto  quien tiene una caponera desde hace un año, además distribuye perfumes productos de limpieza. El invertirá el crédito en la compra de otra caponera ya que con la que tiene no da abasto.
Las otras integrantes son Pilar quien tiene una pulpería y refresquería desde hace 2 años  y Sofia quien vende buñuelos, atol, arroz de leche…entre otros postres tradicionales.
texts.en:
The Neuz group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Alberto, who has had a motorcycle taxi for a year. He also distributes perfumes and cleaning products. He will invest the loan in buying another motorcycle taxi, since the one he has isn't enough. 

The other members are Pilar, who has had a small store and snack shop for two years, and Sofia, who sells buñuelos, atole, rice pudding, and other traditional desserts.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim, 61, is in the business of selling vegetables, which she grows herself. She also buys in bulk from her suppliers. In general, she makes an average of $5.00 per day from the business. When it comes to planting vegetables, Sim’s husband is the main laborer, and manages all the works, however, Sim also works alongside her husband. Sim has been blessed with one child who always assists in the family-owned business when he has free time from his business which is providing a motor-taxi service.  

With the loan of $800, Sim intends to expand her business by buying more vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers. She will use the remaining funds to fix the broken parts of her present house. Her future goal is to advance her farming and selling business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon in Adum Banso. Dora has completed J.H.S. She is married. Her husband is a driver. Dora has been a hairdresser for eight years now. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and wigs for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and wigs for her beauty salon

loans.name: San Miguel Chuanoj Group

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, estudio sus estudios de primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operaria y hasta ahora lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría también.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de hilos de diferentes cuales y colores para el tejido de cortes típicos de diferentes de diferentes estilos y colores, espera en el futuro ver su negocio con operarios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, tejeduría de cortes típicos, tejido de sabanas y a la talabartería.

loans.use: purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia operates a food vendor joint popularly called "chop bar" in Ghana. She needs a loan of $750 to be able to provide proper services to her customers by ensuring food safety and security. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been taken through the TEACH Lending program. She also keeps very good records of her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mohammad Anwor

texts.en: Mohammad Anwor lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the one to support his family. He has a sandal cart that he is helping his family with. Now he wants to  take a group loan to open a new shop and buy all new sandals for his shop to make a good business and attract more clients. He wants to make a good income for his family and support them well. He would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To buy new sandals

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Two years ago, Irina opened a small kiosk in the central market of Stryi, Ukraine. She focused her business on the sale of imitation jewelry and accessories. Hardworking and modest, Irina has successfully used microfinance loans from Nadiya Ukraine to quickly expand and develop her business. With excellent customer service and reasonable prices, Irina’s business has been in high demand. She has managed to take on three employees, including her mother.

Irina has requested a loan of $1200 to open a new business – a little sandwich stall. By opening a second business, Irina hopes to increase her income and employ additional workers.

loans.use: Open a second small business

loans.name: Faauu

texts.en: Faauu is from the Mulifanua Fou Center. She will use her loan of $300 to pay for the overhead costs of a small shop located in the Mulifanua village plantation and farm area. She is very thankful for this microfinance assistance program, as without its support, she would not be able to start her business. She is looking forward to improving her business and her family’s future.

loans.use: To pay for overhead costs

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Thirty years ago, Segundina decided to start a family with Zacarías, her life-long partner. The fruit of that union and their enormous love for each other is their only son, Luis, to whom they try to bring the best education so that he can conduct himself as a fine man of means in the future. Both have always worked diligently selling meat, leather, and sheep’s wool at markets in the cities of Arequipa and Cuzco to displaced people with the goal of getting better prices and increased sales. With their earnings, they have been able to improve the economic stability for their young son and the quality of life for her 77-year-old mother that they lovingly care for. Segundina’s wish is to further increase sales of their products, but to do this they need a loan to invest in their long-standing business. She is committed to repaying the loan within seven months.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina hace más de treinta años decidió formar una familia con Zacarías su compañero de toda su vida, fruto de su unión y el inmenso amor que se profesan nació su único hijo, Luis, a quién cuidan y tratan de brindarle la mejor educación y ejemplo para que en un futuro se conduzca por la sociedad como un hombre de bien.Desde siempre ambos han trabajado diligentemente en la comercialización de carne roja, cuero y lana de ovino, ofreciéndolos en los mercados de las ciudades de Arequipa y Cuzco a los que se desplazan mes a mes con el objetivo de obtener mejores precios y mayores ventas; con las ganancias que obtienen han ido incrementando la solvencia económica de su hijo menor y a la calidad de vida de su anciana madre María de 77 años, a quién cuidan con mucho amor y dedicación.El deseo de Segundina es acrecentar aún más la comercialización de sus productos y para esto requiere un préstamo, que tiene pensado invertir completamente en el negocio de toda su vida; comprometiéndose en rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a mother, who in time, has been able to have a small store to sell her products after they’ve been harvested. Thanks to the little space she’s been able to have in her home, she was able to seed her vegetables more frequently and give them their respective care and attention without interfering with the care and attention she gives to her children, who are still young and require her presence and care. Today she’d like to expand her store and buy some tools for work to enable her to better the variety of her products. She’s hoping to receive a loan to make her dreams a reality and make her business prosper. With your help, she can do it.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

. Lucila, es una madre que con el transcurso del tiempo ha logrado tener un pequeño depósito para seleccionar sus productos luego de sus cosechas y gracias al espacio que pudo tener en su hogar, inicio la siembra de sus productos de manera más frecuente y en mayor cantidad a los cuales les dedica el respectivo cuidado y atención, sin descuidar también el cuidado y atención de sus hijos, quienes por ser aún pequeños requieren de su cariño y compañía.Hoy desea y añora ampliar aún más su depósito y comprar algunos instrumentos de trabajo que le permitirán mejorar la selección de sus productos.Solicita un préstamo para concretar sus anhelos y hacer próspero su negocio, con su apoyo podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: To increase the products in her store and to buy tools to better the variety of her products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna Z. has a business selling fish at one of the busy local markets in Melitopol, Ukraine. Anna’s family has been involved in fish selling for some time. Anna’s mother-in-law was an expert for many years selling fish and Anna’s husband has an identical business at another market. Anna has been selling for about five years and has benefited from the experience and advice of her mother-in-law. Anna and her husband have two small daughters. Their businesses provide the sole means of income for their family.

Anna has requested a loan of $600 to purchase a supply of raw fish that she will be able to marinate and re-sell at her fish stand. This type of fish is popular in Ukraine and should sell well. Anna has benefited in the past with financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase fish inventory to marinate

loans.name: Marach D A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hadijah W.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Hadijah is 30 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Hadijah makes approximately UGX 60000 (~ $35 USD) in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

Hadijah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 200000 (~ $116 USD) to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Hadijah is joined in her small group by Farida M. and Issa R.. Farida M. has a restaurant and wants to purchase more raw food and a refrigerator with the loan. Issa R. is currently operating a business selling rice and wants a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To add to a clothing business

loans.name: Thi Tha

texts.vi:
Mrs Thả is 52 years old. She sells flowers to earn a living for a few years now. She has 1 child who attends school and lends her a hand. She also sells wood. Her family income is about 50000-60000 VND a day (~3-3.75 usd). She never had a loan before. She applied to BinhMinh cdc (SEDA) because she likes the weekly payment arrangement. She's requesting a loan 0f 2006000 VND to by seeds and manure.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thả, 52 tuổi, làm nghề bán hoa được nhiều năm nay. Chị chỉ có một đứa con đang vừa học vừa làm giúp mẹ. Ngoài nghề bán hoa thuần tuý, chị còn đi lấy thêm củi về để bán. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị từ 50000-60000 đồng/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đây cả. Chị thích vay ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được trả góp nên chị đã vay 2006000 đồng để mua phân bón và hạt giống trồng hoa.

loans.use: buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 43 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Souad is a tailor. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs a loan to buy material to sustain and develop her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. sells maize and cassava, and also prepares food for sale. She is a single parent of one child. Her income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She wishes to increase sales, but she is running out of goods.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: The loan is for additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.en:
Angelina T. lives in a small community on the outskirts of Samana, Dominican Republic with her one son Noberto. A seamstress by traD., she sells a combination of clothes that she has maD. herself as well as pre-manufactured clothing to the people in her community. With this loan, she plans to increase her clothing inventory of shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses. Every Thursday, Angelina takes a bus to Santiago, one of the largest cities in the Dominican Republic, where she is able to purchase clothes in bulk for a very good price. When she is not selling clothes, Angelina said that she is usually sewing and enjoying her favorite meal, fish and rice.

Angelina T. is just one member of the 10 person micro-bank, Oasis. These Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Angelina, the Oasis group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, and sewing materials for her clothing business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City where she sells second-hand shoes to people in her community. Gladys learned this business for 2 years.  She started her own business in 1995. Gladys needs the loan amount of $1, 200 to buy more second-hand shoes for sale and also to meet the demands of her customers. Gladys is a LAPO client. She says 'thank you' to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand shoes for sale

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat R. is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Muhabbat began a business so she could get ahead and cover household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough. She is a market vendor. She sells clothing for teenagers in the local market.

As a rule Muhabbat travels to the neighboring city to purchase the goods she sells with the help of her eldest son. In general the business is stable, having a strong trend for further development. However, Muhabbat stresses that after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, she managed to accelerate the process of development of her business considerably.

Thus, for instance, thanks to one of the loans, Muhabbat was able to rent an additional booth in the market. Today she is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business and thus to be able to meet all the needs of her dearest children as day by day, they are growing up and their expenses are rising, too.

With this purpose in mind, Muhabbat is requesting 1200 US Dollars for a term of 10 months. With this loan she is planning to purchase clothing for teenagers. She promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she has done all the previous ones. She thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia has been making earrings and necklaces by hand for 4 years. She used to work making earrings for someone else, but then she decided to become independent. She now sells her products wholesale, to be exported to neighboring countries. Elia has personnel that helps her in her small shop.

The loans she has received have been used to invest in materials she needs to create the earrings and necklaces.

Elia would like to move her shop to a different area, because the competition is very high in the area she works now.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Elia hace aretes y collares a mano desde hace 4 años. Antes trabajaba haciendo aretes para otra persona, sin embargo, luego decidió independizarse. Ahora ella vende por mayor sus productos que son exportados a países vecinos. Elia tiene personal que le ayuda en su pequeño taller.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para invertir en los materiales que necesita en la fabricación de los aretes y collares.

A Elia le gustaría mudar su taller a otra zona, ya que donde ella está ahora hay mucha competencia.

loans.use: to invest in materials she needs to create the earrings and necklaces  (Para invertir en los materiales que necesita en la fabricación de los aretes y collares.)

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años. Ella se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de joyería. Ella visita a sus vecinas de su localidad para ofrecer sus productos.
María cuenta que es viuda, y aunque cuenta con la pensión de su fallecido esposo, le es insuficiente para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hijo que esta por terminar el colegio y desea ir a la universidad. Es por eso que María tiene que dedicarse a la joyería para generar ingresos extras.
El último crédito que María recibió le ayudo a comprar las joyas que ella vende, asimismo ella necesita otro crédito, ya que desea seguir con su negocio de joyería y hacerlo más productivo.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old. She has worked for the past five years selling jewelry. She visits her neighbors in her area in order to offer her products. María is a widow, and although she has a pension from her departed husband, it is insufficient to cover her expenses and those of her son, who is finishing high school and wants to go to university. This is the reason that María has to work selling jewelry in order to get extra income. The last credit that María received helped her to buy the jewels that she sells. She needs another loan for the same reason. She wants to continue with her jewelry business and to make it more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for María's jewelry business.

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is in 4th standard. Her younger son is free and doesn’t do anything. Her daughter is in 3rd standard. Khadija baji’s husband has a clothes selling business. He has been selling clothes for the past 10 years. He buys clothes from Faisal Abad and sells in his own city Arifwala. Khadija baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji and Hanifa baji and Begum baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy iron to make heater to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 35 años, está felizmente casada con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos. Cuando era niña se dedicaba a pastar los carneros de sus padres, tenían en grandes cantidades de ellos, desde que se casó se ha dedicado a la agricultura, debido a que su esposo se dedica a ello, ahora siembran de 3 a 4 hectáreas de papa, dice que les es rentable, sobre todo cuando en el mercado escasea, ella recién la saca a vender, una vez que se cosecha la puede guardar, le dura un aproximado de 3 a 4 meses, mientras tanto sobrevive de la venta de sus carneros, y cuando sube la papa recién la saca al mercado. Cultivar sus tierras le agrada, solo se le hace dificultoso cuando tiene que abonar y medicar sus tierras. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, durante este tiempo ha demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con este dinero comprará  abonos como el Nitrato, Urea y el 18, para que de ese modo reaccionen bien sus cultivos de papa, esto le costará un aproximado de 3500 a 4000 soles.
texts.en:
Elvia is years old, is happily married to her husband and has 3 children. When she was a child she used to put her parents' cows out to pasture as they had large quantities of them and since she married she has worked in agriculture as her husband works in this. Now they grow 3 to 4 hectares of potato, she says it is profitable for them, above all when the market becomes scarce. She recently took them to sell and once that harvest can be stored, it lasts her 3 to 4 months and meanwhile she lives from the sale of her cows and when the price of potato increases she takes it to market. Cultivating her lands makes her happy, but it becomes difficult when she has to fertilize and medicate her lands. This is her 7th loan with MFP, during this time she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. With this money she will buy fertilizers with nitrate, urea and 18 so that in this way her potato crops react well. This will cost her an approximate 3500 to 4000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for potato crops

loans.name: Fatimatu

texts.en:
Fatimatu Z. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through the primary level. Fatimatu sells plastic bowls and other items at Iture near Elmina, which she has done for a brief time. Fatimatu uses her income to pay rent and other utility bills.

Fatimatu will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more plastic products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatimatu plans to save towards building a house which has been her greatest heart's desire.<> The items in front of her are some plastic products, a sample of what she sells.

loans.use: Fatimatu will use the loan for additional capital to buy more plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A. is 42 years old. She is married and has two children – a boy and a girl. The girl is currently in high school while the boy is in university. Afia lives in Bibiani, a farming/mining community in the Western Region of Ghana. Afia’s husband is a farmer. She is an industrious woman. She sells smoked fish in the local market square to help provide for the family. She buys fresh fish and smokes it herself. She says the cost is economical in this way. She buys the fish from the bigger cold stores in the big cities such as Kumasi at wholesale prices. Afia has been in business for over ten years. She supplies mostly to food vendors in her community. She would like a loan to buy more fish in bulk so that she can sell to more customers.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Zena P. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of four and ten years old. Zena has been running a cloth business since 2007. Client’s business is selling African clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase children's clothes and kanga (African tradition cloth). In the future, she plans to buy more cloth for resale. Zena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes and kanga

loans.name: Nila Amanda

texts.es:
Hace dieciocho años Nila empezó a trabajar vendiendo abarrotes al por mayor en un centro comercial. Estuvo dedicándose a ello por ocho años, hasta que el alquiler de su local ya no le era nada rentable. Por este motivo estuvo un tiempo sin trabajar, solo viviendo de los ingresos de su esposo, quien es obrero de construcción.
Tres años después, en el 2001, se animo a vender abrir una pequeña tienda en su misma casa. Una tienda de abarrotes que solo cumplió cuatro años hasta que se mudo de casa. Una vez que se mudo demoro dos años para reabrir su tienda, ay que no tenia el capital suficiente .
Ahora su objetivo es ir creciendo de a pocos en la medida de lo posible en su negocio. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace medio año. Ella es madre de cinco hijos, todos una dependientes económicamente. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien colabora con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eighteen years ago, Nila began selling groceries wholesale in a shopping center. She did this for eight years, until renting her shop was no longer profitable. After closing her shop, she spent some time unemployed, living off the income of her husband, who is a construction worker.

Three years later, in 2001, she decided to open a small shop in her own home. She had this grocery store for four years until she moved. After moving, it took two years to reopen her shop because she did not have enough capital. Now, her goal is to continue to develop her business in whatever way possible. In addition, for the last six months she has sold cosmetics.

Nila is the mother of five children, all of whom are still economically dependent on her. Happily, her husband helps her cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Jessika

texts.es: Jessika tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a realizar bellos trabajos de bordados de ropa típica desde hace 3 años, realiza estos trabajos en su misma casa, y fue su madre quien le enseñó este arte con el que ahora se solventa ella misma. Jessika borda generalmente por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas se va estudiar, la labor que realiza es muy gratificante porque disfruta de realizar cada bordado, además que le permite tener las ganancias económicas necesarias. Es la primera vez que Jessika está solicitando un préstamo con MFP; y está dispuesta a ser  una de las integrantes más colaboradoras de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de telas al por mayor e hilos de diversos colores para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Jessika is 20 years old, and lives in her parents' house. She has been doing beautiful embroidery of traditional clothing for three years, which she does in her own home. Her mother was the one who taught her this art with which she now supports herself financially. Jessika usually embroiders in the afternoons, because she goes to school in the mornings. Her work is very satisfying because she enjoys making each embroidery, and it also earns her the money she needs.

This is the first time Jessika has requested a loan from MFP, and she is ready to be one of the most contributing members of her communal bank. She will use the loan money to buy fabrics at wholesale and for various colors of thread which she will use in her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para sus bordados

loans.name: Mela

texts.en:
Mrs. Mela C. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married with 5 children. Two of her children are married already, two are in school and one recently finished college. Her husband is a carpenter and part-time motorcycle driver.

Due to financial difficulties, she decided to open a sari-sari store to help meet their daily basic needs. She started with an initial investment of 5,000 pesos only. A relative told her about the program and services of Paglaum MPC and she decided to become a full-fledged member in March, 2009. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos.

She dreams that someday her business will expand and she will have a bigger store made of concrete. She hopes to send their children to school and to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. manages a small rice field. She is married and has three children. Aside from farming, Ofelia also supplements her income by making dresses. She is a seamstress and people come to her to have nice dresses made.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals to be used on her farm. The loan will truly help her and the whole family have a better, bigger yield. Ofelia's harvests are intended for family consumption; the remainder is sold in the market for additional income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and the first Filipino MFI partner to go active with Kiva micro-funds. CEVI provides access to people who wants to start a business. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: İkhtiyar

texts.en: İkhtiyar M. is a 45-year-old farmer. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. Currently, his children are high school students, and they always support and help their father with his business. İkhtiyar needs to purchase additional cattle. To fulfill this need, he is requesting a loan of $1200 US. İkhtiyar is grateful for everyone's support.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Мавлонова Манзура, женщина которая берёт кредиты на расширение своего бизнеса. Её бизнес состоит из  продажи детской одежды. За товаром раз в месяц ездит её сын, а торгует она сама. Манзура пунктуально работает с Фондом и довольна всеми условиями. Манзура планирует получив займ пополнить свой бизнес летним подростковым ассортиментом товаров.
texts.en:
Manzura M. is a woman who takes out loans to grow her business. Her business is the sale of children’s clothing. Her son travels for products once a month and she sells herself. Manzura is punctual in her work with the Fund and is happy with all the conditions. Manzura plans to use the loan to add an assortment of teenage summer products to her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen T., 58, makes and sells baskets, making $3 each day in Batambong province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband, Duk Choam, is a soldier and makes approximately $1 each day.

Pen T. would like a loan of $400 to purchase rattan for her business. She will be able to increase her profits through making more baskets.

In the photo, Pen T., right, is pictured with her sister.

loans.use: To purchase rattan to make more baskets

loans.name: Dora Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 07 hijos (1 a su cargo), tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en la av. Panamericana s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar, arroz, papas, pescado, queso, sal, aceite, etc., para la venta de comida el cual es su negocio actual.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa (Miraculous Medal) village bank located in the Pomata district in the Chucuito province of Puno, Peru. She is 60 years old, married and the mother of 7 children (one of whom still lives with her). She has an elementary school education and lives on Panamerican Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years; her first loan of ~$100 was used to invest in her business selling food. She is now requesting a loan of $175 to purchase rice, potatoes, fish, cheese, salt, oil, etc. to be able to sell food in her current business. She would like to keep working in order to keep progressing. She enjoys the savings and the classes provided by the village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, potatoes, fish, cheese, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Bekpulat

texts.ru: Хайдаров Бекпулат проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 38 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бекпулат по специальности "техник-электрик" проработал 17 лет. Вот более 5 лет, он начал заниматься сельским хозяйством. Кредит просит для посева урожая. Сеить хочет он арбуз. На полученную прибыль хочет купить мелко рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Bekpulat H. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. Bekpulat had worked as an electrician for over 17 years. It has now been over 5 years since he became involved in agriculture. He is requesting a loan for sowing watermelons. He wants to use resulting profits to buy small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sowing watermelons

loans.name: Liz Anghela

texts.es: La señora, es una cliente nueva de la institución, ella  se dedica a la venta de accesorios para teléfonos celulares en la zona 16 de julio, su negocio es ambulante, su esposo se dedica a la venta de artefactos al por mayor que lo distribuye en las zonas mas concurridas de La Paz, su tenencia de vivienda es familiar por lo cual su domicilio es de su padre, ellos en futuro piensan adquirir una casa propia pero por el momento y por la falta de capital viven en la casa de sus padres, la pareja actualmete tiene un solo hijo que tiene dos años de edad. La Sra. Liz I. invertira el préstamo en la compra de mascaras para teléfono celulares.
texts.en:
This woman is a new client of our Institution. She sells cellular phone accessories in the “16 de Julio” area door-to-door. Her husband sells devices wholesale for distribution in the most crowded areas of La Paz. They currently live with her parents because they lack the capital at the moment to buy a house. However, they hope to have their own home in the future. The couple has two year old son.

Sra. Liz I. will use her loan to purchase cell phone covers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phone covers

loans.name: Magnoudéwa

texts.fr: Cette dame est célibataire et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle vend uniquement du charbon de bois et du maïs pour subvenir à ses besoins. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2004 dans le quartier Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle vend ces deux produits au bord d’une route secondaire très fréquentée de beaucoup de piétons et automobilistes, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaires. Pour renouveler son stock, elle voudrait avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter  05 sacs de charbon de bois et 02 sacs de maïs. Le reste du montant servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers Atakpamé, son lieu d’approvisionnement.

loans.use: Achat de charbon de bois et de maïs

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en: Kayed is a 32-year-old man and father of 4 children. He has owned a specific Lebanese food kiosk since 1995. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Kayed is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to renovate his kiosk in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: renovate his kiosk

loans.name: Villamenia

texts.en: Villamenia is 59 years old.  She is married to Elizardo and they were blessed with two children and they are both married.  Villamenia is managing a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village and she is thankful for the improvement that is happening to her business.  In order for her to further improve her business and so with their way of living, she is requesting to request a loan of PHP5000 from the KIVA lenders as business capital.  This amount will be of great help for the expansion of her store.  She hopes that her requested loan will be approved. Her husband Elizardo is a private driver. The couple wanted that they could be able to sustain their needs. Villamenia and Elizardo would like to earn bigger capital for their security purposes when they get old.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
Mam M. is 36 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang Province. She earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises the ducks to produce eggs and then she sells the eggs to people who come to her house to buy in bulk. She is married and has five children who attend the local public school. Her husband, Chan Lin, works with her in the business. 

Mam M. has applied for a loan from HKL, a Kiva field partner, to purchase additional feed and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducks to raise

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene sells drinks, toiletries and gift items at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to excel in her business.  She is married with three children. She is 46 years old. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. 

She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more gifts items, toiletries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gifts items, toiletries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Simas

texts.en:
Mrs. Simas San, age 49 and her husband, Mr. Rophech S., age 54, were married 30 years ago and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one is fully employed and the youngest is in the fifth grade. The family is living along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Simas San has been selling recycling materials for two years. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for five years. She hopes to expand her recycling business in order to generate more income and support her family. Mrs. Simas San is requesting a loan of $300 to buy additional recycling materials for resale.

loans.use: To buy more recycling material for resale.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo D. C. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de  Chalatenango, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 5 años de edad. Él posee una venta de verduras, negocio en el cual su esposa le ayuda a vender su producto. Reinaldo solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder contar con una mayor variedad de verduras, y de esta manera aumentar las ventas, debido a que dicho negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que le permite tener estable a su familia con todo lo básico y necesario para ellos. Reinaldo es un señor el cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias ya que se destaca por ser un padre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, el cual cuenta con el deseo de brindarles todo lo que ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Reinaldo D. C. is 30 years old, and lives in the department (administrative region) of Chalatenango. He lives with his wife and their two daughters who are 6 and 5 years old. He has a business selling vegetables; his wife assists him with selling his products. Reinaldo requests a loan since he wishes to be able to have a greater variety of vegetables so as to increase his sales. This business is the only source of income that allows him to have a stable situation for his family and provide for all of their basic and necessary expenses. Reinaldo is a man who has very good references and who stands out as a hardworking father who is dedicated to his family and wishes to provide them with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs Aun T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 40 years old and lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr Hun Chou, is a fisherman who makes a small income to support his family (he is shown on the left in the photo).
