Mrs Aun T. is the mother of four children: one is a construction worker, while the others are in school except for the youngest who is too young for school (this child is only two years old).

Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support the family, so Mrs. Aun T. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a cow to start a new breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start new breeding business

loans.name: Dilshodboy

texts.en:
Dilshodboy is 26 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He is a humble farmer dedicated to growing vegetables and raising his two sheep on his land. To do this work, he has to leave early in the morning and go back home late. But when he sees the results, it comforts him. He wants to increase his production because he knows that he will have better results from a larger harvest.  The vegetables will also need to be of better quality in order to get more income from the sales. In order to do all this, he needs to invest large amounts of money.  He wants to increase his vegetable production and purchase more sheep to breed. That is why he applied to IMON International for a loan of 10500 Somoni.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of fertilizer and sheep

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian R. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Lilian is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Mercedes L. G., tiene una pulpería desde hace 15 años ubicada a dos cuadra del mercado central frente al centro de salud es su casa de habitación, su negocio lo empezo con un capital de C$30,000.00 aporte de su esposo con poco inventario y poco mobiliario para mi venta.
Anteriormente ella estudiaba y luego decidio poner una venta con ayuda de su esposo  tienen una niña de cinco años de edad, su negocio lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ella trabaja fuertemente para sacar el sustento diario para su hija.
Ella es primera vez que saca financiamientos con nosotros pero espera que no sea el único ya que ella lo solicito para surtir su negocio y no seguir agarrando productos al crédito ya que al contado ella hasta logra descuentos y promociones.
texts.en:
Blanca Mercedes L. G. has had a grocery store for 15 years located in her home, which is located two blocks from the central market across the street from the health center. She began her business with a 30,000 colon capital investment that her husband put up; she had little inventory and display capabilities. Befor this, she was a student. Later on, she decided to start a sales business with help from her husband. They have a 5-year-old daughter. The store operates from 7am until 9pm. She works hard to earn sustenance for her daughter. This is the first time that she has sought financing from us but hopes it won't be the only time. She requested funds to stock her store so that she doesn't have to continue to buy items on credit because by paying cash she can get better discounts and promotional terms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: Mr. Srey Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loan group consists of 20 people. Mrs. Srey N. is the group leader in this village, Srae Boeng in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Chhoeng, is a soldier who does not earn enough to support the family that consists of two children, one a student in the local school, and the other a five-year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for growing crops

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia wants a loan to buy items (cosmetics, hair dryer) for her beauty salon. Nasreen wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit-selling business. Tajan wants a loan to buy wood and nails for her furniture-making business. Naghma naz wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shazia is the wife of N. M. and the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. 

Shazia's husband runs a canteen in a local school where he sells the home-made items (e.g., kababs and French fries). Shazia helps her husband by preparing the food for his canteen. They both get up early and help each other. Their earning help them to cover the expenses of their household. Shazia is applying for a loan to buy materials (potatoes, cooking oil and spices) to expand their canteen business.

loans.use: To buy material for canteen business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
la sra. Josefa F. D. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Oscar Armando Ortiz quien trabaja como motorista, tiene dos hijos que ya son independientes y que le ayudan algunas veces en el mes en lo economico. Josefa se dedica a la venta de refrescos, churros, tamales y golosinas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos al por mayor, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa F. D. is 41 years old, she lives with her significant other, Mr. Oscar Armando Ortiz who works as a motorcyclist, she has two children who are independent and who help out economically some times during the month. Josefa sells sodas, churros, tamales and candy.

The loan will be spent on buying sodas at wholesale prices. She needs the profit to cover the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Mrs. Dédé d’Almeida is 57 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a retired accountant, so it is up to her to provide her family’s income. To do so Madame d’Almeida sells charcoal and firewood out of her home in Lomé, Togo.

Mrs. d’Almeida has requested her first loan from WAGES of 150,000 CFA. She plans to use the loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Traoré est âgée de 48 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants. Elle  vit  dans une famille polygame avec son époux sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala  (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons familiales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est très vite intéressés aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par choisir la vente de tissus et divers il y a 10 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, en quantité et en qualité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Après  2 prêts solidaires tous remboursés correctement,  elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce  financement  elle compte acheter,  5 pièces  de tissus et divers à Lomé et effectue sa vente dans la ville de Koutiala au grand marché  de la ville, à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant ou a crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Mme Oumou Traoré, 48, is married with six children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife and their children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). She never went to school, because very quickly she became interested in helping heer mother earn money. After trying several occupations without success, she ended up selling cloth and other goods ten years ago. Her reputation is good; each month she gets many orders. After having received two group loans, both fully repaid, she is now seeking her first individual loan. With this help she plans on buying five pieces of cloth and other goods in Lomé and will sell them in the big market in Koutiala, for cash or credit. She hopes to turn a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA to repay her loan, share in paying day-to-day family expenses, and invest in other money-making ventures.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Tamemsusor Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsusor” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in a small village called Masorie, about 32 miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu S. (second from left).  Kadiatu is approximately age 42 and was born in Masorie. Her husband is a farmer and they have six children -  two attending primary school, two in secondary, one in college and one no longer attending school. 

For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling food items such as rice, palm-oil, salt and sugar. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will be able to expand her business size and quality by buying the above mentioned items at wholesale, to add to her current supplies.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm-oil, salt and sugar for resale

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn T. is from the village of Biasong. She is 38 years old. Noralyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Noralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Noralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Mrs. Delia C. is from the Barangay of Silangit, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years of age and married to Edwin C., a Security Guard. She is blessed with one child who is still a minor.  To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store. She is also receiving regular support from her husband from his salary. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for almost a year already and earns approximately PHP 1,500 a month from this business activity.

In 2010, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as her first loan. She will use the loan as additional capital for her newly opened sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, child’s education, insurance and possible business expansion. 
		
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her newly opened sari-sari store

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El comité “Mujeres Unidas 3” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Roque Alonso.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas , tres integrantes son empleadas Domesticas y una Empleada publica ,estas señoras también trabajan en  ventas de varios productos en sus horas libres o fin de semanas. 
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Nancy es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, además fabrica sabanas, almohadones, manteles, servilletas, también fábrica estuches para muestrarios de joyas y otras artesanías. 
En fin realiza realiza varias actividades, es un señora muy creativa en su actividad, y todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con varios  hijos y su marido quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Nancy solicita el crédito para la compra de maquina especial para colocar broches a las confecciones que realiza.
texts.en:
Description: The “Mujeres Unidas 3” (United Women 3) group was formed by several neighbors from the city of Roque Alonso. All of the group members are involved in independent activities. Some are in sales, others prepare fast food. Three are domestic employees and one is a public employee. They also work selling several kinds of products during their spare time or on weekends. The members make up a very solid group capable of group activities that strengthen their companionship. Nancy is one of the group members. She manufactures clothing for women, men and children. She also makes sheets, pillow cases, tablecloths, napkins. In addition, she also makes jewelry cases and other crafts. In other words, she’s a very creative woman who is involved in a wide variety of activities. All of her customers are always in awe of her work. She has a very united family composed of her husband, who works as a Security Guard, and several children. She is very happy with her activity and with the training the group receives. Nancy is asking for funds to buy a special machine to install clasps on the articles of clothing she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a special machine that installs clasps.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie L. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Elsie is married and has two school-aged children. Elsie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion M. is from the village of East Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 57 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $30 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Consolacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “LIBERTAD” está iniciando su tercer ciclo, en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada 28 días, durante seis meses para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas.  Las socias consideraron este plan de pago, con la confianza de que se conocen y que pagarán puntual.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Verónica como presidenta, la señora Rosa como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Judith.

La señora  Verónica es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar  que la Mesa Directiva, Jefes de Grupo y socias de bases cumplan con los reglamentos acordados  al inicio del ciclo de crédito. Este es un gran desafío para ella, por que la señora Verónica cuenta con sólo un ciclo en la asociación. Ingresó a la misma gracias a la invitación de una señora.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende ropa, aprendió de su hermana hace cuatro años.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs 1000.-, para este ciclo ha solicitado Bs.2000.-, en ambos casos el dinero es destinado para la compra de mercadería.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación tenemos: venta de verduras, limpieza de ropa, tejido a máquina, venta de ropa, venta de artículos varios, compra y venta de cuero de res, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The Liberty Comunal Association is starting its third cycle with the Panamericana Focal Center [which brings together over 100 communal associations]. It is composed of nine members. The women will meet every 28 days over the course of  six months to empower one another and make their payments. The members thought over this payment plan and are confident that they are familiar with it and will be punctual. The board of directors is composed of Veronica as president, Rosa as treasurer, and Judith as secretary. 

Veronica is a young woman of 27 years. She is married and the mother of three. As president of the association, she has the task of making sure the board of directors, group leaders, and members follow the terms agreed upon at the start of the loan cycle. This is a good challenge for her, because Veronica has been with the association for only one loan cycle. She joined the association thanks to a woman’s invitation. 

Her business is selling clothing. Her sister taught her how four years ago. Her first loan was for 1000 bolivianos, and this loan cycle she has requested 2000 bolivianos. In both cases, the money goes towards the purchase of merchandise. The rest of the members of the association have businesses where they carry out vegetable sales, clothes washing, machine knitting, clothing sales, blanket weaving, the sale of various articles, and purchase and sales of leather.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business selling plastic beans (which are used in making plastic bags). Utilizing the loan money, he will buy a bulk quantity of plastic beans, which will help him fulfill larger orders on time. He mainly receives orders from factories.
  
Mussarat performs her duty as a seamstress to help her husband in meeting the financial needs of the family. She works for neighboring clients and receives good orders every month. 

She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Rana colony, in the city of Gujranwala. It is an industrial city of Pakistan. She has three daughters and a son. Her son is the eldest one, and he is a motor mechanic. He couldn’t get an education because he didn’t show any interest in it. But her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. 

Mussarat is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Bayardo Heriberto

texts.es:
Don Bayardo de 49 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores en edad escolar, labora para el Supermercado San Antonio como gerente de distribuidora de agua desde hace 20 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su vivienda, esta vez echandole la ceramica y ademas ponerle el cielo razo y si el dinero alcanza poner azulejos al baño para de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Bayardo is 49 years old, married, and has three children who are under school age.  He has worked for the San Antonio Supermarket as a distribution manager for water for 20 years.  

He is requesting his second loan with the goal of continuing to improve his home, this time laying the tile and putting up the ceiling, and if there is the money, laying bathroom tiles – all for the purpose of providing greater comfort to his family.

loans.use: Echar piso, poner cielo razo

loans.name: Khurshida's Group

texts.en:
Khurshida S. M. lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives in the area named 69-EB, and owns a two-room house where she has been living for more than 25 years.
 
Khurshida is the mother of five sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a government employee, while others are studying in different classes.
 
Khurshida is married to S. M., who is a loader by profession and uses a donkey cart for his loading business. He loads different items such as construction supplies and fruits and vegetables and transports the items to the designated places to earn income.
 
Khurshida is also involved in an animal sales business, which she does to financially assist her husband. She purchases goats from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them, and sells them for a profit.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s loading business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in some areas, which doesn’t allow him to put a load on it.
  
With the new cart her husband will provide better services to his clients and do his job better. Khurshida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and it will help her family to live a better life.
 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes the loan will be a good step towards the growth of her husband’s business.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khurshida.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly O. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 64 years old. Shirly is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Shirly owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Shirly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Shirly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou T., 66, sells used clothes, earning $6 US per day. T. is married and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a teacher, earning $2 US per day. The family has to spend $35 US on food, $5 US on electricity and $15 US on other expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of $1200 US to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her cloth selling business. She started this business six years ago in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She buys clothes from city Lahore and sells in her local city Gujranwala. 
Gujranwala is a midsized city of Punjab Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Gondalanwala with her family in a three room brick house.  She shifted here since her marriage 21 years ago. 
Her husband is a blacksmith by profession. He makes spare parts and iron rods on order and earns income for the family. He is operating this business for past 20 years and is an expert in his field. 
Shamim has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her elder son drives a van and offers pick and drop services to school and college students. Younger son is an electrician by profession. Her daughters are studying in 11th and 10th grades respectively. 
She is very hopeful that an investment will take her business to more profitable position. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamim”.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Sisa

texts.en:
Sisa is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a fishing business. She lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1990 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Sisa is borrowing PHP 19,000 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sisa hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah R., 42 years old, lives in Pangkung Liplip Kaliakah Village and is the head of the group "Wiguna Merta", which has obtained a loan for second period of Rp. 15,000,000. The group has a total of 10 people, so that each person will obtain a loan of Rp. 1.5 million. 

Ni Nengah R. raises pigs from piglets up to the age of three months. They can then be ready for sale so that within six months, she may sell two times. Ni Nengah R. can maintain 3 to 4 head of pigs. From the sale of livestock she can obtain an average income of Rp.600.000 per six  months. From this income she is able to help cover the family living expenses. The members of the group hope that in future this cooperation can continue to run smoothly.

loans.use: Buy more pigs

loans.name: Kossi Ninyo

texts.fr: Monsieur  kossi  a  43 ans  avec  3 enfants. Il  est né  à   Amégnran   et  habite   quartier  Nukafu. Il  fait  le commerce  de vitres  et  cadre  de  photo pour s’occuper  de ses  enfants.  Il a reçu  2  crédits  de Wages  qu’elle a bien remboursé déjà.  Il a débuté  son activité en  1998  et  revend  sur le Boulevard  Jean  Paul  II.   Il s’approvisionne au Ghana  à  Accra. Il  sollicite   un  prêt  pour  acheter  100 barres  de  vitre.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi is 43 years old and has three children. He was born in Amégnan and lives in the Nukafu district. He sells photo frames and framing glass in order to support his children. He obtained two loans from WAGES in the past and repaid them already. He launched his activity in 1998. He sells at the Jean Paul II Boulevard. He stocks up in Accra in Ghana. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase 100  framing sets.

loans.use: Purchasing photo frames and glass

loans.name: Zulfikor

texts.en:
Zulfikor is married and has one daughter. He lives with his family in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. Zulfikor sells good quality bedclothes and carpets in the central city market. His vending kiosk is well known in the market for a wide assortment of goods at affordable prices. 

Zulfikor started his venture nine years ago. He is hoping to expand his assortment of goods and is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni. His perfect credit history with IMON International proves his integrity and capacity to repay the current loan. We believe Zulfikor’s ability to transform his business into what he wants it to be and make profit in the process will lead him to ultimate success in the venture.  
  
        
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase new goods to sell.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en: Asia is 46 years old and has eight children who range in age from 8 to 23. For the last three years, she has made a living by running a beauty salon. Asia is applying for this loan to buy more supplies for her shop. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy six piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Luisa works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business and also earns additional income from frozen foods.  Luisa is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda es una señora de 60 años de edad que vive con su esposo en el distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Ermelinda siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  sus vecinos la conocen por ser una persona amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar.

Desde hace 5 años Ermelinda cuenta con un negocio de bodega- bazar que esta situado en la sala de su propia casa. La bodega de Ermelinda es una de las bodegas más surtidas de la zona. Ella atiende todos los días y por eso cuenta con una gran demanda y  con una clientela fija. 

Ermelinda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, el cual destinará en la compra de un lote de mercadería de artículos de primera necesidad .Esto le permitirá incrementar sus inventarios y por ende las ventas, para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Ermelinda es ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha sido puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is a 60 year-old lady who lives with her husband in Tambogrande district - Piura.  Ermelinda has always been a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her neighbors know her as a kind person who is always ready to help.

For five years, Ermelinda has owned a grocery / general store business which is located in the living room of her home.  Ermelinda's store is one of the best-stocked in her area.  She serves in her store every day.  For this reason, she has a lot of demand and regular customers.

Ermelinda is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use this money to buy a batch of merchandise (essential household products).  This will allow her to increase her inventory and, thereby, her sales so that she can continue growing in her business.

Ermelinda is an existing client of our institution and has been punctual in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a batch of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Michael. He is married and has three children, aged 11, 7 and 4 years. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they are his late brother’s children.  

In 2009, Michael established his rice business. He began his business because he needed a reliable means of getting income to support his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Michael requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Michael plans to extend his business and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for additional local foodstuffs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
For the last seven years Daniel has been operating a shop in the Kitiri area, Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 39 years old and married to Agnes. They have one schooling child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member from KADET, located in the Ndunyu Njeru office. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to add more stock of trousers and shirts.

In the future Daniel aspires to practice dairy farming in the Kariri area, Ndunyu Njeru town

loans.use: To add more stock of trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking fat, oil and wheat flour. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, cooking fat, oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Myrna has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. 

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken and pork barbecue.


In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken and pork barbecue.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
Arturo tiene 28 años de edad y tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de La Convección  (Cusco, Perú) pero ahora vive en la ciudad de Echarate a una hora de la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). El tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de materiales de ferretería. Ya es un año que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas como por ejemplo guías, pinturas, colas de carpintero y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital city of the La Convención province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  Its primary business activities are the production of coca, coffee, cacao, and fruits.

Arturo is 28 years old, and he has one child.  He was born in the city of Quillabamba, La Convección province, Cusco, Perú.  However, he now lives in the city of Echarate, which is an hour from the city of Quillamba (La Convención, Cusco).  

He has a small family business, which consists of selling hardware.  The business has been operational for one year.  It is going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

On this occasion he needs a loan to buy materials and tools like guides, paint, carpenters’ glue, and other things.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools.

loans.name: Kalagi Basooka Kwavula Group

texts.en:
39-year-old James' philosophy is that without diligence nothing prospers. He is a businessman who carries himself around with a robust sense of purpose. The congenial and go-getter father of four says hard work has always played first fiddle as he goes about his 16-year-old restaurant business trivial round in the metropolis of Mityana in central Uganda, in East Africa. There is a discernable beehive of activity at his restaurant business.  He set forth in this business with savings from his farming enterprise a few years back. He still plies his farming business and he says it helps him to reduce the deficiencies from his restaurant business income.

The fact that James is a risk tolerant entrepreneur has also been one of his strongest stocks in trade. He, however, says he has lots of leeway to make up to reach a fully satisfactory rate of growth in his business. Needless to say, the farming business has come in handy as he is able to harvest crops and use them at his restaurant. He grows and harvests staple foods like bananas, cassava, beans, rice, beans, etc. This helps cut down on the costs of purchasing food, especially with the current status quo where food prices are soaring every day.  For James' group, this will be the fourth loan. The records show a good repayment pedigree. Weekly, James says, his gross sales income totals up to Ugandan shillings 50,000. James is requesting fhis Kiva loan to purchase better furniture and cutlery to use at his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase better furniture and cutlery for his restaurant.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 44 years old and has five children. Ruth is married and has four children who are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ruth has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel nació en la comunidad de Amaru de la ciudad Pisaq (Perú) y tiene 73 años de edad, él tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, él tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Miguel requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.  

Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Miguel was born in the Amaru community in the city of Pisac (Perú).  He is 73 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He currently lives and works in the city of Pisac.

He has a small grocery store in his home.  He has had it for several years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Miguel needs the loan to buy basic needs products like rice, sugar, noodles, and other things.

The Mosoq Ñusta Communal Bank meets every month in the Pisac district, Calca province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is a well-known touristic and commercial region. It is also known for the traditional feast of Inti Raymi, and it is also the location of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Edith Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene 26 años de edad; vive con su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos.

La señora Edith se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración de comida típica tales como empanadas, tamales, yuca frita, entre otros. Ella aprendió esta actividad de la abuela de su compañero de vida, quien le enseño. Ella antes se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos.

Para adquirir sus insumos la señora Edith tiene que trasladarse durante una hora en bus a una ciudad de la zona oriental del país y así poderlos comprar.  

La señora Edith esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para terminar la construcción de su negocio y además poder comprar algunos insumos para la venta. El cafetín esta situado a la orilla de una laguna la cual es visitada por muchas personas ya que es un sitio turístico.

Con la terminación de su cafetín la señora Edith podrá resguardar los productos y atender mejor a los clientes, ya que ella antes los vendía yendo de casa en casa a pie. En un futuro a la señora Edith le gustaria crecer su negocio de un cafetin a un pequeñno restaurante. De esta manera ella mejorara sus ingresos ya que su local esta más accesible para los clientes.

A la señora Edith le gustaría en un futuro ampliar el local y mejorarlo para pasar de un cafetín a un comedor ya mas organizado y dar mejor atención a los clientes
texts.en:
Edith, 26, lives with her life partner and four children.  For the last three years she’s been preparing traditional meals like turnovers, tamales and fried manioc, among others.  She learned this activity from her spouse’s grandmother who taught her.  She used to sell cosmetics.  To get her ingredients Edith has to take a one-hour bus trip to a city in the east of the country to be able to make her purchases.

Edith is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to finish building her snack bar and to be able to buy some ingredients to sell too.  The snack bar is located on the shore of a lake that’s visited by many people because it’s a tourist site.

With the completion of her snack bar Edith will be able to safeguard her products and better tend to her customers because she used to sell going door to door on foot.  In the future, Edith would like to make her snack bar grow into a small restaurant to improve her income this way since her snack bar would be more accessible to customers.  Edith would like to expand the site in the future and improve it so that it will go from being a snack bar to being an eatery and be better organized to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to finish building her snack bar and to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Aggrey W.

texts.en: Aggrey is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children aged between 2 and 11. He describes himself as focused and determined to fight poverty. He operates a dressmaking business. He has been involved in this business for ten years and employs one staff member. Aggrey describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to buy materials and more machines, which sometimes makes it impossible to deliver clothes on time. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase an embroidery machine and more materials. His business goal is to design clothes for the public and operate a wholesale business within five years. Aggrey hopes that, in the future, he will be able to offer job opportunities to fellow Kenyans by having a big tailoring company.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and more materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working in the construction field for the past 10 years. In 2008, he bought a digging machine and started to work with it, sticking with multiple construction projects. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children’s schooling fees. Ali’s only target is to allow his children to pursue their education properly until graduating.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Celeste Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CELESTE” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Florinda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de salchipapas, venta de chamarras, costura de pantalones, venta de quesos, tienda de barrio.

La señora Florinda,  indica que hace cinco meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora y de compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que viene trabajando hace diez y seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Celeste” community bank are about to start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Florinda.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling food, selling sweaters, selling 'salchipapas' (traditional Peruvian fast food), selling jackets, sewing pants, selling cheese and running a neighborhood store.

Florinda says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five months.  She joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer and some friends.  She has a grocery store business where she has been working for sixteen years.

Florinda will use the loan that she is taking out to increase her capital (buying noodles, rice, sugar, etc.).  She will buy these products in La Ceja and then sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Florinda replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”KANTUS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Nicanor;  El socio  tiene 68 años de edad, El socio  es casado, El socio  tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja dentro del banco comunal 4 años y el  es carpintero, el socio trabaja para diferentes obras y lo contratan por años, el también pudo invertir sus anteriores créditos en la compra de una cepilladora, un circular, y una compresora, entonces ahora cuando tiene tiempo y generalmente se da espacio, el socio realiza diversos trabajos de manera independiente de carpintería como muebles, estantes, reparaciones y otros, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para invertir en su taller de carpintería comprando herramientas varias para mejorar las que ya tienen años, el socio comprara serrucho, taladro, martillo, clavos entre otros, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo, como serrucho, clavos, martillo, taladros entre otros.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicanor is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantus” which is located in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 68 years old, married, and has two children. Nicanor has worked with the Communal Bank for four years and is a carpenter by trade. He works on different jobs on which he has been hired over the years. Nicanor invested his previous loans in the purchase of a planer, a circular saw, and a compressor. When he has the time and the space, he also performs different independent carpentry jobs such as making furniture, shelves, or doing repair work. On this occasion, he wants a loan to invest in his carpentry workshop. Nicanor plans to buy different tools to replace the ones that he has had for years. He plans to buy a saw, a drill, a hammer, as well as nails and other supplies. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

Nicanor is grateful for this loan and promises to complete his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy a saw, a drill, a hammer, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is an industrious and optimistic person. He is a farmer in their community, tilling a small parcel of land for farming that is their main source of income. He dedicates himself to his farm activities to improve his family’s status of living. Johnny is 43 years old now, married and blessed with three children. His loving wife also helps him in their business to lessen the burden on his part and save more expenses for labor cost. They hardily work together to increase their yields for the future of their children. 

Due to financial constraint, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for the labor costs required for planting corn. After all, he knows that this is for the sake of their business success. He hopes for further development of their cornfield through those inputs he will acquire through the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs required for planting corn.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phally sells pigs, and her husband sells rice. Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a plot of farmland and more rice to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and more rice to resell.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
La señora Ligia  tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con el señor Wilson quien tiene 34 años de edad, ambos nacidos en la ciudad de Caacupé. Tienen 2 hijos  uno de 7 años y el otro de 3 años. 
La señora Ligia tiene un taller de Costura hace más de 5 años, allí fabrica y vende las remeras con  la imagen de la virgen de Caacupé. Ella comenta que tiene mucho trabajo en especial en estas fechas, ya que se acerca la fecha 8 de Diciembre (fecha Espiritual del País, fiestas de la virgen de Caacupé) porque recibe pedidos al por mayor  de sus clientes que en su mayoría son vendedores que cuentan con sus casillas en los alrededores de la basílica. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos para la elaboración de remeras, con las cuales podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ligia, 32, is married to Wilson, 34. They are both from the city of Caacupé and have 2 children, one who is seven years old and one who is three.

For more than 5 years Ligia has had a sewing workshop where she makes and sells t-shirts with the image of the Virgin of Caacupé. She says that she is especially busy during this time of year because it's getting close to the 8th of December, a religious holiday for the festival of the Virgin de Caacupé. She receives bulk orders from her customers who are mostly merchants who have stalls around the basilica. 

She asks for a loan to buy fabric, thread and other products to make t-shirts to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other products.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Предыдущий кредит Оксана использовала для того, чтобы закупить новые игрушки, разные заколки для волос девочкам, новогодние украшения и т.д. Благодаря увеличению ассортимента реализуемого товара у Оксаны увеличился стабильный доход на 1 500 гривен по сравнению с прошлым годом. Это очень ободрило Оксану и вселило в нее больше доверия к кредитным услугам КИВА. 
В этот раз Оксана берет кредит, так как у нее есть необходимость в обновлении товара. 
Сейчас Оксана ждет ребенка, она уже на 6 месяце. Вместе со своим гражданским мужем она живет в недавно приобретенном собственном доме.
texts.en:
Oksana used her previous loan to buy new toys, different hairpins for girls, Christmas decorations etc. Thanks to the increase in assortment of goods sold by Oksana, her stable income increased by 1,500 hryvnia compared with last year. This encouraged Oksana very much, and gave her more confidence in the KIVA loan service. 

This time Oksana is taking out a loan because she needs to restock the products. Currently Oksana is expecting a baby; she is already 6 months pregnant. Together with her common law husband, she lives in their newly purchased own home.

loans.use: to restock the products in her vending facility

loans.name: Vu

texts.en: Vu is 42 years old and has 2 children who are of school age.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising pigs. She also manages a small wood working shop. Participating in SEDA’s credit program since 2008, she has used loans to invest in expanding her income-raising scale.  For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material for her wooden item making process.

loans.use: to buy wood as material for her wooden item making process.

loans.name: Mirian Iliana

texts.es:
Mirian, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, ella tiene su negocio que es un chalet el cual vende comida rápida, pupusas, sodas y golosinas, debido a la necesidad de mantener sola a sus hijos se decidió a poner este negocio y todos los días lo atiende de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mercadería como: carnes, pollo, verduras y bebidas, el cual le ayudara a tener  variedad y podrá obtener más ingresos diarios.
El sueño de Mirian es con el tiempo poner un comedor en su casa y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida y mejorar cada día en clientes.
texts.en:
Mirian is a single mother and has three children.  She has her business, a store that sells fast food, "pupusas" [stuffed corn tortillas], soda, and sweets.  She decided to install this business because she needed to support her children alone.  She sees to the business every day from Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as meat, chicken, vegetables, and beverages.  This will help her to have variety, and she will be able to have more daily income.

Mirian's dreams are to install a restaurant in her home in the future, for her family to have better living conditions, and to improve with her customers every day.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
El señor Marvin es un hombre trabajador quien desde hace más de 20 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal. El inicio con unos cuantos productos y poco a poco fue aumentando y comprando mayor cantidad.
El invertirá el crédito en naranjas y mandarinas ya que esta es su temporada.
texts.en:
Marvin is a hardworking man who for more than twenty years has worked in the business of fruits and vegetables in the city market. 

He began with a few products and little by little he expanded and bought larger amounts.

He will invest the money from the loan to buy oranges and tangerines as they are in season.

loans.use: to buy oranges and tangerines.

loans.name: Agbéko

texts.en:
Mr Agbéko K. H. is married and father of one child and has five dependants. They have live at “Mawuli” poultry farm in Klémé since 1993. Having served in the veterinary heath centre of Adidogomé, he mastered veterinary treatments. Today, breeding in Togo remains undeveloped and submitted to the native selection. To that fact, the need for animal protein is a crucial problem which he is passionate about. But those means are very limited to respond to the professional requirements and to the demands of his customers who are becoming more and more important. As a good manager, he has successfully managed his first credit of $ 850 with honesty and rigour, which increased his credibility. Mr Agbéko K. H. requests a credit $ 1 500 to buy and sell the veterinary products of best quality to other breeding people in order to raise the breeding quality in the area.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur H. K. Agbéko, marié et père d’un (01) enfant et cinq (05) autres personnes à sa charge, détient la ferme avicole « MAWULI» à Klémé depuis 1993. Ayant servi à la clinique vétérinaire d’Adidogomé, il maîtrise bien les prestations des soins vétérinaires. Aujourd’hui, l’élevage au Togo est resté rudimentaire et soumis à la sélection de la nature. De ce fait, le besoin en protéine animale est un problème crucial qui le tient à cœur. Mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour répondre aux exigences de la profession et aux impératifs de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. En bon gestionnaire, il a su bien géré son premier crédit de $850 avec honnêteté et rigueur, ce qui augmente sa crédibilité. Monsieur H. K. Agbéko sollicite un crédit de $1500 pour acheter et vendre des produits vétérinaires de meilleure qualité aux autres éleveurs afin de relever la qualité de l’élevage dans la zone.

loans.use: to buy and sell the veterinary products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the renovation of her premises in order to exhibit her final products. She'll also buy wood with which to craft furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa Lakoh is married with four children. He runs his shop in the small town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. His wife Adamsay helps him in the management of the shop and both work cooperatively. Isa is forty-three years old and he is planning to build a family house in two years.

Isa's previous loan from SMT helped him expand his business and he now plans to diversify his stock more so that he can have more customers and income. He is requesting a loan of $350 and he feels sure he will be able to pay it back within ten months.

loans.use: Diversify inventory in his grocery store to attract more customers

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Description of Business

Cruz and his wife have 8 years of experience in their business. Ever since he was young he has enjoyed this activity. They work every day of the week from 8am to 7pm in a small shop they have. He also travels to other villages nearby to sell merchandise during festivals.

Use of Loan

They will use the loan to buy costume jewelry and cosmetics for their business. They would also like to include a line of plastic products.

Personal Information

Cruz is 27 years old. He and his wife have four children, two of whom are students. They live in a small house made of reeds and they are renting the shop where they sell their merchandise. Their hope is to have the shop well stocked, and begin to construct a house of cement.

Descripción del Negocio

Cruz junto a su esposo tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Desde joven le gusto esta actividad. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. en el local que poseen. Su esposo se dedica también a la venta de mercadería viajando en los pueblos de la provincia cuando hay fiestas.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de bisutería y cosméticos para su negocio. Además de incluir la línea de productos plásticos.

Información Personal

Cruz tiene 27 años. Es casada. Tiene 4 hijos. Dos de ellos estudian. Su casita es de caña. Actualmente ellos alquilan el local donde tienen su mercadería. Su deseo es poder tener surtido su local. Y comenzar a construir su casita de cemento.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina has tried to get ahead in life and help her husband with the household expenses, given that he works as an independent bricklayer and goes long periods of time without work. She started selling cosmetics through catalogues and later selling shoes. However, when her husband suffered an accident that left him unable to work for a long time, the care he required made Florentina neglect her business. With their small savings, she started buying general merchandise to sell, setting up a small room in her house for this end, and thanks to the help of one of her three children who quit her job to help Florentina take care of her dad and attend the new business.

Currently, they want to offer a greater variety of products in their store, to have better things to offer to their clients. With this goal in mind, Florentina is requesting a loan for US $475 to be paid in a period of 4 months. They are confident that with this money they will be able to make their business grow and have more clients. With your help, Florentina and her family will be able to recuperate from this terrible accident.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Florentina, a tratado de salir adelante, y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, puesto que el señor trabaja como albañil independiente, y en largas temporadas no tiene trabajo. Comenzó por vender cosméticos por catálogo y posteriormente comenzó a vender zapatos. Sin embargo, su esposo sufrió un accidente que lo dejó sin trabajar durante un largo tiempo, y los cuidados que necesitaba hicieron que Florentina descuidara el negocio que tenía, y con unos pocos ahorros que tenía, fue como empezó a comprar abarrotes para venderlos, adecuando un cuartito en su casa, y con la ayuda de una de sus 3 hijos que se salió de trabajar para ayudarle a Florentina a cuidar a su papá y a atender el negocio.

Actualmente están buscando, surtir de más productos su tienda, para poder tener mejores cosas qué ofrecerle a sus clientes, por lo tanto está solicitando Florentina un préstamo de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con ese dinero están seguras que su negocio podrá crecer y tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda Florentina y su familia podrán superar este terrible accidente.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for general store

loans.name: Munnawer

texts.en: I am Munnawer B. from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and have six children,  four boys and two girls. We live in a small two-room brick house. My husband deals in livestock, and my son runs a small corner stand where he sells soft drinks and cigarettes. He would like to increase the inventory he sells there, and we are asking  for a loan of $350.

loans.use: Buy inventory for a soft-drink stand

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (C) Group

texts.en: Hadijah runs a poultry business. She would like to use the extra business profits to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for breeding

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
Matilde Norbeto M. was born on June 26, 1958 in the Chitevel district in Boane. She is 50 years old, widow with 7 children. She was raised in Boane and attended school until the 3rd grade. She met her husband in 1978, because of the war they had to seek refugee in the neighborhood 3 of Guegege in Boane.

Matilde joined the Gueguegue credit program but did not continue because they only offered group loans and borrowers had to take responsibility for the group. She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema by a neighbor. With her first loan she bought a refrigerator. With the loan of 20.000mt to increase the volume of her business. She is looking into getting a store of her own. With the income from the business she supports her children and pays for their schooling. Her business has a positive impact in the neighborhood because it brings the products closer to people, in the future she wants to buy a b bigger refrigerator and open a fish business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao:Bairro 3 Gueguegue Cliente: Matilde Norberto M. Actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00MT ( 847.00 USd) Aplicação :compra e venda de produtos da 1ªnecessidade Inicio 05-02-08 Fim 29-07-09

Matilde Norbeto M. ,nasceu aos 26 de Junho de 1958 em Chitevel distrito de Boane,tem actualmente 50 anos de idade viúva com 7 filhos ,viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais em Chitevel-Boane . Frequentou a escola até 3ªclasse . Conheceu o seu marido em 1978 e como não tinha alternativa de emprego dedicava-se na êDevido a guerra de desestabilização tiveram que abandonar a casa e refugiar-se no bairro 3 Gueguegue em Boane Depois da morte do marido passou-se já a se dedicar muito no comercio para a sobrivivência . Teve o seu 1º contacto de empréstimo com associação Gueguegue localizada no bairro do mesmo nome que ofereciam créditos em grupos ,não tendo sido uma boa experiência de credito porque para alem dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham que assumir a responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos elementos do grupo não efectuasse o pagamento . Conhece a Hluvuku-Adsema, através da vizinha e dai aproximou e solicitou o seu 1ºemprestimo para compra de congelador ,Com este empréstimo de 20.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio ,adquirindo mais mercadoria.

Actualmente esta explorando um pequeno estabelecimento próprio ,mas sendo o único no local que oferece um bom ambiente do negocio,com os rendimentos do mesmo suporta as despesas da escola e de saúde dos seus filhos O seu negocio tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque coloca o produto mais perto do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos da deslocação dos clientes . Ela dirige pessoalmente o seu negocio e na ausência a filha é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo. Futuramente pretende comprar mais um congelador maior, para abrir outro tipo de negocio (venda de peixe).

loans.use: To buy stock to increase the business

loans.name: Abdulhai

texts.en:
Abdulhai S. is 47 years old. Abdulhai and his wife have raised three children and now Abdulhai is supporting his parents.

Abdulhai is a market vendor. He sells office supplies in the local market. Abdulhai's wife, who is pictured above, helps him sell the goods in the market.

Abdulhai has been in this business for ten years already. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Abdulhai to support his family and his parents.

Now Abdulhai plans to increase the range of office supplies he sells. For this purpose, he requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. Abdulhai is a client of IMON, with a positive credit history, and promises to repay this loan in a timely manner. He thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies in order to increase the range of goods he sells at the market.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 27 year old man who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Abbas is a barber. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs a loan to buy material to sustain and develop his barber shop.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is married with two children. Her grocery business is doing well and she wishes to increase her food production and sales.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more food items for the food production and sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has one twelve year-old daughter. To support her family, Ingrid owns and works in a small shop selling clothing, shoes and perfume. She struggles with being able to pay the bills because her customers purchase items on credit and then don´t pay her back. She then has to track them down and get the money from them, but sometimes they don´t have enough. Because of this, Ingrid has to take out loans and stay in debt.

Ingrid has had one loan with Esperanza International and successfully paid it back. She is thankful to Esperanza for the opportunity to borrow money at a low interest rate and also to save some money. With the next loan, she hopes her business will one day be debt-free. She aspires to provide her daughter with a great education so that she can become a successful professional. With a proud smile on her face, she said her daughter is a good student.

loans.use: To grow her business and provide for her daughter

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou C. is 31 years old, married with 2 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for 7 years. Her business consists of buying sheets and dresses and re-selling them in Ziguinchor. The income drawn from her business allows her to participate in the family expenses and medical costs. She is asking for a loan which will be repaid at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou C., 31 ans, mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des draps et des robes et revendre à Ziguinchor. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell dresses and sheets

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru:
Mehrinisso N. is a businesswoman. She sells eggs in the Dehkon Market, providing the primary source of income for her family - her husband and two children. At 34 years old, she has 10 years of experience in this business. To further develop the buisness, she wants to increase sales turnover by taking out a loan. She will repay the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурова Мехриниссо бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей на рынке «Дехкон» . Торгует яицами. Опыт работы в данном бизнесе 10 лет. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода семьи. Мехриниссо замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей 34 года. Для развития бизнеса хочет увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Amelia es casada, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos, Amelia vende helados típicos de la región llamado Muyuchi que significa Da Vueltas en quechua, Amelia prepara los helados actividad que aprendió de su abuela, el helado se prepara con leche, ajonjolí, coco rayado, azúcar que se prepara en una olla de acero llamada heladera que se pone al medio de una batea de madera con hielo y se da vueltas constantes (de ahí surge el nombre) hasta que endurezca. Actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Amelia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, vasos, ajonjolí y hielo. Los sueños de Amelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Communal Bank Senor de Luren. She is 41 years old, and married with 3 children. Amelia sells a kind of ice cream called Muyuchi, which means "Two Turns" in the native language of Quechua. She learned how to make this ice cream, which is typical to the region, from her grandmother. It's prepared with milk, grated cocoa, sugar and other special ingredients, which are put into a kind of stainless steel kettle and stirred constantly in a trough of wood and ice until it begins to solidify. She runs her business every weekend in the main plaza of Ayacucho.
