Amelia needs the loan to purchase sugar, glasses, ice and other ingredients to prepare and sell her ice cream. Her dream is to continue to grow her business, and to be able to see her children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Amelia will use the loan to purchase sugar and other ingredients, as well as glasses, for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Afolau

texts.en: Afolau V. is 59 years old and married with seven children.  She has worked in the plantation business for many years with her husband, and often sells her produce to people in her village.  Afolau earns about $185 per week, and has successfully repaid previous loans.  Because microfinance is her only access to capital, Afolau is now requesting a loan of $500, which will be used to purchase herbicides and other equipment to further increase her agricultural productivity.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, pesticides,back sprayer etc

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo Wilver de 12 años de edad, el cual estudia en el colegio. La venta de comida es el negocio de Filomena desde hace ya 16 años, actividad que adoptó como fuente de ingresos, para mantener a su hijo. Realiza la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la cual prepara en su casa, para luego salir a ofrecerla en su pequeño triciclo, hasta  aproximadamente las 5 o 6 de la tarde, lo bueno de este oficio es que a Filomena le encanta realizarlo, ya que es muy buena en la cocina, lo cual pueden notar los clientes que se van muy satisfechos luego de probar las delicias que prepara Filomena.  El motivo del esfuerzo de esta madre, es por su hijo Wilver, el cual está en proceso de educación, por lo cual Filomena quiere brindarle las mejores oportunidades en cuanto a educación. Comprará con el préstamo que reciba, ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos, ya que quiere aumentar su producción de comida. En el futuro, Filomena se ve vendiendo su comida en un local propio.
texts.en:
Filomena is 50 years old ans she lives with her 12-year old son Wilver, he is currently attendig school. Filomena's occupation is food sales and she has been doing so for the past 16 years. She started her business as a source of income to support her son. She makes her food sales door to door, but she prepares her foods at home to later go out an sell on her small tricycle. She sells until about 5 or 6 in the evening. The best part about the work is that Filomena loves doing it. She is a very good cook and her clients notice because they all come away feeling satisfied for having sampled the delicious foods prepared by Filomena. The movitation for this mother is her son, Wilver. He is currently attending school and he wants to provide him with better opportunities. With the funds from this loan she will purchase ingredients to prepare her dishes especially because she wants to increase her production. In the future Filomena sees herself selling her foods from her very own stand.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare the foods that she sells.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Dos Mil (“Two thousand”) Village Bank. She is 46 years old and married with three children. Maria runs an Internet café from her home. She also sells cosmetics by catalog and sells seasonal decorations for Christmas, Carnaval and Peruvian Independence Day, which she sells from a cart in Ayacucho’s main plaza. 

Maria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to bring Christmas decorations in from Lima (a 9 hour bus ride from Ayacucho) to sell. 

Maria would eventually like to open up a store of her own to sell lots of different things. She plans to use the money she has saved at FINCA to open the store. She has been working with FINCA for about five years; her house was built with FINCA savings.

loans.use: Buy Christmas decorations

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz N. is 19 years old. She lives with her parents. She is a well-known seamstress in her community. She has more than two years of experience.

Two years ago, Dilafruz decided to take advantage of her reputation. Her father bought her a sewing machine. Since then, she has been working as a tailor. She is now a successful entrepreneur with well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. She constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Now she is requesting a loan of 3700 Somoni ($1100 USD) for the term of 12 months so she can purchase a new, modern sewing machine to make dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Dilafruz and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S. lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Mech Kim, uses a motorbike with a side-car to transport passengers. Mrs. Im S. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a driver while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday I. sells tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Sunday is 26 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en Quechua.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery garcía en donde vende flores variados, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 4 de la mañana.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gladiolos, rosas.
Los sueños de Norma son salir adelante y darles una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Norma is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. Norma has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells a variety of flowers. She works in the stall every day starting at 4.00 am. Norma is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase gladioli and roses. Her dreams are to move forward in life and help her children to pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gladioli and roses

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is a rice grower. He owns 3 hectares of land in the village. He is married and has five children attending school. He has been tilling their farm for 20 years now. He admitted that to farm is difficult and very hard work. "But if you love the soil, it will love you back", he said. "The land will provide your family the food and their other needs", he added. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will also go to buy pesticide to avoid insects that inflict disease in his rice. He is also thinking of other possible income areas to help his family as well.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help eradicate poverty. CEVI helps people start and have their business. They not only provide credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm input, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en: Malaea M., 64, is married with four children.  She has four years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~260 USD).  SPBD loans are Malaea’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine, materials, and needles

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Leilila G. manages 2 hectare of land. She is a 58-year-old, hard-working mother of six children. Her husband, Dionito G., is helping her manage the farm to feed and clothe their family well. She dreams of having more land to farm someday. She also wants to send all her children to school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her yield. In addition to that, she is also interested in venturing into another line of business to augment their income.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own livelihoods. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a business-woman from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is now 27 years old and already married to Lacer D., who helps her in their present business. They have been gifted with three children. Two of the children are studying in elementary level while the youngest is just a seven-month-old baby. 

Jennifer started her snack vending business when she got married while her husband has been operating their passenger tricycle, which serves as their source of income. Sometimes, they use their tricycle as their service in vending and they are gaining a net average income of 300 pesos daily. Their income is not enough to sustain the family with their daily needs and to maintain their tricycle business. For this, she is hoping to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 ($US 125) to be used in purchasing more products to sell and to be able to have a greater income for the future use of their children in school and in their home necessities. The loan will be of big help also for the maintenance of their tricycle transport business. She is happy that her husband is always supporting her by accompanying her in selling. She hopes that with the sacrifices she makes, together with her husband and with the help of our God, they could be able to support the studies of their children and meet the daily expenditures of their family. Jennifer aims for a better living and she believes that by working hard and having patience in work, her goals will be possible to attain.

loans.use: Business improvement and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: El Adji

texts.fr: EL HADJI D. est membre de la mutuelle depuis plus de deux ans et a une grande expérience dans le commerce de détail,il a ouvert une boutique chez lui au quartier som de thiès;après l'obtention de ce financement,il envisage de renforcer son stock de marchandises
texts.en:
El Adji D. has been a member of the mutuelle for over two years and has much experience in retail commerce. He opened a shop in his home, in the Som district of Thiès. After obtaining this financing, he envisions bolstering his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment his working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen G. manages a small parcel of rice field. She is 48 years old and has four children. She and her husband work so hard to be able to raise their children well by providing them with their needs. She started farming in 1994 and the family is able to earn Php 30,000 every harvest. Now, she needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm materials. The loan will really help her family sustain their livelihood. CEVI is reaching out to more and more people to help them to start and have a business. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer de 33 años que lucha por sus 3 hijos, ya que es padre y madre para ellos y gracias a su trabajo logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa propia. La venta de ropa de bebé es la actividad que ha realizado por más de 8 años, teniendo la posibilidad de vender su mercadería en los puestos de sus amistades a quienes deja un porcentaje de sus ganancias. De esta manera obtiene ingresos económicos en diversos puestos del mercado; por ello, desde muy temprano por la mañana, visita cada puesto para dejar su mercadería y posteriormente realiza las cobranzas. Adicionalmente; los fines de semana, vende sus prendas de forma ambulante en las diferentes ferias de su localidad, caminando desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Pero este sacrificio tiene su recompensa en las gratificantes ganancias que obtiene con sus ventas. El deseo a futuro de Kelly es tener un puesto de venta estable donde venda sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad. Este es su 13avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y lo que más valor de su banco comunal es el trabajo en equipo que realiza con todas sus compañeras. La compra de prendas durante estos meses es muy beneficiosa debido a la temporada de invierno, pues la demanda de ropa abrigada se incrementa y los 1500 soles que solicita le servirán para la compra de esta mercadería.
texts.en:
Kelly is a 33-year old woman who fights alone to support her 3 children, as she plays the role of both mother and father to them. Thanks to her work, she managed to buy a plot of land where she built her own house. She has realized the activity of selling baby clothing for more than 8 years, having the opportunity to sell her merchandise from friends’ stalls in the market. For this, she pays them a percentage of her earnings and she generates income from various locations at the market. She visits each post very early in the morning to deliver her products, and later collects her profits. Additionally, she sells her wares on weekends at the different markets in her area walking from 9 am until 6 pm. However, this sacrifice has its reward in the income she earns with her sales. Kelly’s wish for the future is to have a set site where she can sell her clothes more easily and comfortably. This is the 13th credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA and what she most appreciates about her cooperative bank is the teamwork she has with the other members. Buying clothes during these months is very beneficial given that it’s winter, therefore the demand for warm clothing goes up and the 1,500 soles she requests will help her buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one grown up son. She owns a retail business that sells clothing. She has been in this business for 9 years. There is almost no competition in the area where Svetlana works. It gives her a great sales advantage. Svetlana is a very active, honest and hard working person. She develops her business all the time increasing the sales and income.

Svetlana would like to borrow 13,800 UAH to purchase school uniforms for sale. This will give her additional income that she is going to use to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
N. Ruth is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a bar business that she has been running for over 5 years. In the bar she sells beer, sodas, wine, spirits and local brew to her customers and such a variety enables her to earn a gross weekly income of 80,000/=.

From her profits, she has been able to acquire pigs and, at the moment, she has 4 in number, though this keeps on increasing and reducing due to buying and reselling and producing all the time. She has also been able to buy and own household items and pay her children’s school fees with much ease compared to before the loans.

loans.use: Buying more drinks like beer, sodas, and local brew for increased stock.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: ousmane B. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis aout 2004.il exerce l'activite d'artiste serigraphe depuis plus de sept ans .il sollicite un credit decent soixante quinze mille (175 000)frs pour acquerir du materiel pour developper son activite.
texts.en:
Ousmane B. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2004. He has been working as a silk-screen artist for over seven years. He’s requesting a loan of 175,000 francs to acquire supplies and equipment to develop his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: God Bless You Club #2 Group

texts.en:
God Bless You Club #2 is a group of 4 borrowers led by Fatu J., 47 years old, married with 4 children aged 6-26 years old; their educational levels 3rd-11th grade. She also cares for her siblings. Fatu is also a high school graduate but didn't have the opportunity to further her education because of poverty. Fatu lives on Benson Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia but living in poverty.


Fatu’s business is her dry goods shop. She buys wholesale and sells provisions like sugar, candles, matches, Maggi, insecticides, etc.,  retail. She has been running this business for 6 years and she started with a very small amount of capital but now runs a shop. 

Because Fatu’s husband does not have job anymore, she takes care of all the expenses in her home.
By buying better goods and arranging them in an orderly fashion in the shop, she attracts customers and makes them always want to come and buy from her.

Fatu needs this loan to purchase more dry goods like rice, sugar, candles, etc. to make more profit;
 her goal is to establish bigger shops in and around Monrovia, Liberia. Fatu also dreams of improving her own and her family's lives and seeing them become better people in society.

loans.use: Fatu needs this loan to purchase more dry goods like rice, sugar, candles, etc. to make more profit

loans.name: Josephine Waiyego

texts.en:
Josephine I. is married to Cyrus a Business man they have no children yet. They reside in the Eastern part of Nairobi.

Josephine oprates a retail store selling different things including maize flour, soft drinks, different grains and many more. The clients' area of business is along a main street with high population and she relies on the residents and passersby as her customers.

Josephine was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and she has no Previous credit history. She will use the loans she has applied for to increase stock in her retail store for items which are in high demand. With the extra profit she plans to expand the business further as she aspires to have a wholesale shop after expansion.

Josephine describes herself as focused and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the stock of Maize flour, and maize grains at this moment of high demand.

loans.name: Komuna

texts.en:
D. Komuna is 40 years old and married with two children. Her business involves purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni in order to purchase additional cows to meet customer demand. Komuna believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and further increase their income to aid her children's education. You could become an important part in the life of Komuna and her family. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cows to resell

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son L., age 54, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are married, one living in a separate home and the other one living in the family home. Another daughter assists her mother in the business. They live in a small village aL. National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Son has been selling Cambodian cakes for five years. She buys ingredients from the market to make cakes by herself and sells them in her village.

Son hopes to supplement her income with another business raising cows; she will get more income from selling cows after they grow big enough. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise. She will also use a part of her loan to buy sweet rice for producing Cambodian cakes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise and to buy sweet rice

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 55-year-old widow with eight children who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She cares for her children on her own, and hopes above all to give them a good education. She makes a living selling groceries, drinks and food. She has been in this business for many years, and hopes to earn a good profit during the current high season. Helen has applied for a loan for $350 to buy more drinks, groceries and food to sell to her customers, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, drinks and food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mr. Thach T., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Thach Houn, 46, (pictured together) have been married for over 25 years and have six children: two sons and four daughters. They are living along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Thach has been a mason for 12 years, while his wife has been selling vegetable for 10 years. He is asking for his first loan of $600 to help his wife to purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Theoun

texts.en:
Theoun T., 47, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she is involved in a business of manufacturing traditional Cambodian violins as souvenirs for tourists who visit Angkor Wat Temple, earning an income of US$ 5 per day. Her husband helps his wife and earns the same amount of income. These sources of income help cover family expenses.

T. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate better income. Therefore, T. is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Phangheng

texts.en: Mrs. Phangheng S. is 33 years old. She lives in Preaek Ta Sau village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support the rice field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phangheng S. and her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and fuel. Her husband, Mr Chat Seng, helps her to do farming and also for supporting their family. Mrs. Phangheng S. is mother to three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The third child is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and fuel.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.en:
A. Sadbarg is a happy mother of three children. She is 34 years old and married. Sadbarg is a teacher. Her salary is very little and that’s why she has been running her own grocery business. For 15 years she has been selling foodstuffs such as: baby food, sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and many others in her grocery store.

Sadbarg’s wish is to increase her business, offering various types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Sadbarg.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, beans and groundnuts, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.  Joyce is 45 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store and educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of  groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man. He stopped his education when he was too young and started working as a furniture painter in 2005. He chose to leave his education and go to work to help his father in the household and to raise his four unemployed brothers. He paints all kinds of furniture and he has a good number of clients. Mohamad is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional paint, supplies and tools to satisfy the heavy demand of the market and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy additional paints, supplies and tools

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 36-year-old divorced woman. After she divorced, she moved back to her parents' house and started working as a beautician from her home. She works as a hairdresser and also does manicures, pedicures and other beauty services. Her business allows her to help with the household expenses. 

Today, Rania is requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand her home business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment. She wishes to increase her business productivity and income as a result of this loan and to attract new clients.

loans.use: To expand her home business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Pictured here is Rebecca M.. The 38-year-old was born in Sawuliya village, about five miles from Makeni. She has 4 children and her husband is a farmer. Rebecca’s children are attending school – one is in secondary school, two are in primary school and the last is in nursery school. 

For three years now, Rebecca has been running one of the most popular restaurants in Makeni. She sells cooked rice, meat, fish, and vegetables. She also sells 'acheke' (fast food made out of cassava roots) and soft drinks. 

Rebecca is seeking a loan of SLL 4,000,000 for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further develop her business. With this loan, she will buy cooking materials like rice and palm oil. She will also use part of the loan to rebuilt part of her restaurant that had a fire accident some months ago. She will buy thatch grass to roof the building.

loans.use: Buy cooking materials like rice and palm oil and thatch grass to roof her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Cette  dame  a installé depuis 2003 son propre restaurant dans lequel elle ne sert à ses clients que de  la  nourriture togolaise,  pour pouvoir bien gérer son commerce, elle a impliquée 4 personnes de sa famille dans la gestion de son commerce, sa clientèle se compose de toute personne. Elle voudrait compléter ses économies afin de se réapprovisionner avec les matières nécessaires à   son activité de restauration,  elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 6 sacs de riz, 4 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de spaghettis et 5 sacs de maïs. Elle est divorcée de son mari et a 3 personnes à charges, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges et à celle de ses enfants
texts.en:
Since 2003, this woman started her own restaurant where she sells only Togolese cuisine. In order to manage her business well, she hired four people from her family as management for her business. Her clients are made up of all kinds of people. She would like to save up her money in order to restock with the necessary supplies for her restaurant. She is asking for a loan from WAGES to purchase six sacks of rice, four barrels of oil, ten cartons of spaghetti, and five bags of maize. She is divorced from her husband and takes care of three people. With the revenue from her business, she supports herself and her children.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 47 años de edad, convive con su actual pareja y tiene un hijo en su haber. Reside en la comunidad de Palestina, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Hace más de 30 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola, vale decir, al cultivo de cacao y café. La razón por el cual incursionó en este rubro, es que detectó que la gran mayoría de sus competidores no producían sus productos agrícolas a gran escala, además que los mayoristas que acopiaban los productos de café y cacao, no le reconocían económicamente el valor que merecía sus productos. Es por ello que Francisco desea producir en cantidad y calidad, con el propósito de vender a un precio justo. Hoy a sus 47 años, considera que ha cumplido su meta de ser uno de los lideres en su comunidad, esto gracias al esfuerzo constante, sin embargo no quiere conformarse, por lo que tiene pensado ampliar su mercado en otras zonas estratégicas, comprando amplios terrenos de cultivo, con la finalidad de minimizar costo y tiempo a la hora de trasladar y vender sus productos a los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Este es su tercer crédito con  MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente respaldado por su grupo comunal por lo compromiso y responsabilidad que tiene consigo. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar insumos y abonos para que mejore sus plantaciones de cacao y café, de esa manera evitaría las plagas que afectan sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old. He lives with his his partner and has one child under his care. He lives in the community of Palestina, located in the beautiful Cuzco rainforest, where he has his own house. He has been working in agriculture for more than 30 years, growing cacao and coffee. The reason why he entered into this area is that he saw that the vast majority of his competitors didn't produce their agricultural products on a large scale. In addition, the wholesalers who stockpiled the coffee and cacao didn't acknowledge the financial worth of the products. That is why Francisco wants to produce in quantity and in quality, with the goal of selling at a fair price. Today, at 47, he considers himself to have reached one of his goals of becoming a community leader thanks to his constant efforts. Nonetheless, he does not want to rest. That is why he has plans to increase his market in other strategic areas, buying large crop areas. The idea is to minimize cost and time when it comes time to transport and sell his products in the warehouses in the community. This is his third loan with MFP and he is committed to complying with his payment schedule. In addition, he feels supported by his community group because of the committment and responsibility he has with it. With the loan he is asking for he will buy materials and fertilizers to improve his cacao and coffee crops. This way, he can avoid the diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to protect his cacao and coffee crops.

loans.name: Maritza Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Piura, perteneciente a la provincia y región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y comida en una bodega – tienda instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella brinda a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario con un trato amable lo cual le permite mantener una clientela fija. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Durante los ultimos meses su bodega ha experimentado una creciente demanda gracias a la promoción que le ha hecho sus clientes, Maritza desea ampliar su stock de productos para poder responder mejor a nueva demanda que viene experimentando, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Maritza es una mujer emprendedora y que se ha propuesto trabajar para lograr el bienestar de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the settlement of Santa Rosa, a marginalized urban area in the city of Piura. This area is in the province and region of Piura, and located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. For more than a year, Maritza has been selling basic necessities, groceries, and food from a store inside of her home. There she provides her customers a variety of everyday consumer products and friendly service. For this reason, she has managed to maintain a steady customer base. With the revenue she generates from her business, Maritza is able to help her husband in supporting their family For the past few months, her store has experienced an increase in demand thanks to the publicity generated by her customers. Maritza wants to expand her inventory of products so that she can better respond to the increased demand. This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help achieve her objective. Maritza is an enterprising woman and proposes to work for the well-being of her family. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Odilonia Yarati

texts.es:
La Srta. Odilonia Yarati es soltera, vive en casa  de sus padres donde posee una despensa bien surtida, con este negocio ella los mantiene ya ellos estan están al cuidado de ella.
Ella esta muy satisfecha con su negocio y desea ampliar para aumentar sus ingresos, para ello solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general para su despensa  así como fideos, harina, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, enlatados, panificados.
texts.en:
Odilonia Yarati is single and lives in her parents' home where she has a well-stocked store. She takes care of her family with this business as they are under her care. She is very satisfied with her business and wants to expand to increase her income. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase merchandise for her store such as pasta, flour, rice, sugar, candy, canned items and baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of flour, candy, baked items, dairy items, canned goods, candy, rice, oils, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Veimar

texts.es:
El Señor Veimar C. B., es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y sus tres hermanos menores ya que su padre falleció cuando el tenia sus 14 años y desde entonces él se hace cargo de su familia.

Veimar C. B. es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el cliente trabaja diariamente con su motocicleta para el sustento de su madre y sus hermanas  para que en un futuro ellos tengan y gocen de las comodidades de las que él no gozo en su juventud.

El señor Veimar C. B. se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un vehículo para así poder facilitar la vida que llevan, y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de madre y sus hermanos y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Veimar C. B. is single and works to support his family, which consists of his mother and his three younger siblings. His father died when he was 14 years old, so he was left in charge of the family.

Veimar is a young man who is dedicated to his work. Every day he works with his motorcycle so that he can support his mother and his sisters so that they can have a future and enjoy the comforts that he was not able to experience as a youth.

Sr. Veimar visited the offices of CIDRE to request a loan for the down payment toward the purchase of a vehicle that he can use to earn a living. This will allow him to have more income for the welfare of his mother and his siblings, as well as to build a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a taxi

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
These women are members of the “Wan Word” group. They are small scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve. 

Agnes K. (left) is the leader of this group. Agnes was born in Makeni. She is 30 years old. Agnes is married with no children. Agnes sells dishes and bowls. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With her share of this loan, Agnes will buy a large quantity of bowls and dishes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bowls and dishes

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat S. was born in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 35 years old. She was born into a low-income family and after the divorce of her parents, she grew up at her grandmother’s house. Saltanat graduated from secondary school, but could not continue her studies because she had to help her grandmother around the house. She milked cows, pastured the cattle and cultivated land. 

Saltanat got married at the age of 22 and soon she gave birth to a son.  After an unfortunate family life and the death of her grandmother, she moved to Kara-Balta town, near the capital city of Bishkek. In order to get income, Saltanat decided to start up her own business.  Using the capital of 10,000 KES, she bought a supply of electrical appliances to resell, which she sold at a local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to her strong efforts. 

She managed to multiply her investments and raised her circulating capital to 70,000 KES. In 2004, Saltanat got married in second time and gave birth to two sons. One son is now four years old and the second is a breast-fed infant. 
 
Saltanat plans to use the loan of 50,000 KES to broaden her business by expanding the range of products she sells. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to open one more selling place at the market.  Speaking of her plans for the future, she dreams of buying a minivan. 


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden assortment of goods

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who have selected Mrs. Mom N. as their group leader. She is 37 years old and lives in Thommoda village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan in the best way it can improve their own living. 

Mrs. Mom N. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Theng Bun, is a construction worker and also a palm juice collector. It is time to plow her field, but she does not have enough moN. to do that, so she is asking for a loan to rent a plow for plowing her field. With the rest of the loan she plans to start a new business by buying pig food and a piglet for breeding. 

She is the mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, three are studying in the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To rent a plow for plowing her field

loans.name: Rigoberto Santos

texts.es: Rigoberto Santos M. de 46 años de edad, reside en el Municipo de la Union en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace un tiempo en una parte de su domicilio tiene instalado un taller donde arregla motocicletas y gracias a este negocio ha logrado sostener a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y ademas atiende una pequeña pulperia, y sus 6 hijos de 18,16,14,13,11 y 4 años de edad, de los cuales 4 se dedican a estudiar en el colegio y 1 en la escuela de la localidad. Èl solicita el prestamo para surtir su negocio de repuestos como ser llantas, fricciones, juegos de traccion, rines, bufias, entre otros. Espera tener mas clientes y que su negocio poco a poco vaya creciendo y que le deje mayores ganancias para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar. Su esposa e hijos lo consideran un hombre luchador y cariñoso, somos una familia humilde pero unidad expresò uno de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un local mas grande y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Es su primer credito en FAMA y esperamos una buena conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Santos M. is forty-six years old and lives in the municipality of Union, in the department of Olancho. For some time now he has had a workshop in his home where he fixes up motorcycles. He has been able to support his family thanks to this business. His wife spends her time taking care of the house and she also takes care of a small general store. His six children are ages 18,16,14,13,11 and 4. Four of his children are in high school and one goes to grade school. He is taking out a loan to stock his spare-parts business and bit-by-bit be able to grow and earn more money to keep on supporting his home. His wife and children see him as a caring man who fights hard for what he needs. "We are a humble, yet tight family," the children said. His dream is to have a bigger place and to provide his family with a higher standard of living. This is his first loan with FAMA and we are expecting good behavior in terms of payment.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motercyle parts.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya T. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and young son in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son, 4, attends a local kindergarten, while her husband is currently unemployed. 

Oyuntuya sells a variety of consumer goods out of a shipping container in her town. She started her business in 2006 by selling a variety of goods in an outdoor stall at the local market and has built a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her to purchase a shipping container that she uses as a shop.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to operate a transportation business for her husband. Oyuntuya is a very open-minded and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more inventory for increasing her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Perizat's Group

texts.en:
Perizat T. is the leader of the group. She is 35 and married. She has a son and three daughters. The son and two older daughters are at school, and the third daughter is still too young for school.  Five years ago, with the initial investment of 25000 soms, Perizat and her husband started to breed cattle. By reselling cattle after fattening, she makes 6000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. 

Svetlana B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and married. She has a son and a daughter, both at school. Svetlana and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. They resell cattle after fattening. In this way they make 3000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Svetlana wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. 

Erkinbek S., 38, is married. He has two daughters and a son. The first daughter studies at university and the other children are at school. Erkinbek works as a private driver and his wife provides sewing services. They also breed cattle. With the money received from the loan, Erkinbek wants to purchase a bull-calf in order to increase the number of cattle. 

Kunduz A., 37, is married. She has a son and two daughters. Kunduz is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as a welder. Kunduz applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Mirla Annali

texts.es:
Mirla tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Tongorrape del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año ha instalado en su vivienda una pequeña bodega con la que ayuda a solventar la economía de su hogar. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad así como abarrotes y golosinas. Su esposo trabaja como profesor en un colegio de la zona y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos.

Mirla ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa. En aquella oportunidad  ella deseaba ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos
y gracias al crédito obtenido pudo lograr su objetivo. Actualmente desea seguir implementando su negocio gracias a la demanda que cada día crece más. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Mirla sigue trabajando para llegar a lograr su más grande anhelo: ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales de éxito. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva.
texts.en:
Mirla is 25 and married. She lives with her husband and two children in the Tongorrape area in the district of Motupe, which is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has had a small grocery store in her home for a year.  This business helps with her home's finances.  She offers her neighbors various basic products like groceries and candy.  Her husband works as a teacher at the high school in the area, and together they take good care of their children.

Mirla has worked previously with a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa.  On that occasion, she was hoping to expand her business and to buy more products, and thanks to the loan, she was able to accomplish her objective.  She currently hopes to keep implementing her business thanks to the demand that is growing every day.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa fo 1,000 PEN

Mirla keeps working to reach her biggest dream:  to see her children become successful professionals.  She is very grateful to the people who collaborate with her through Kiva.

loans.use: To keep implementing her business thanks to her demand that is growing every day

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. Rany S. (pictured with her grocery store) was married in 1999 and has one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and the other is still young and stays at home. 

Rany has been selling groceries since 2006. She is a silk weaver as well. Rany has had several Kiva loans already. Now is requesting another loan of $300 to repair her grocery store.

loans.use: To repair her grocery store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old, married and has three children.  She is a new client with Faulu Kenya and she hopes to grow her business through them.  

She sells shoes and fish for a living.  She was previously selling food to earn a living.  Janet hopes to expand her business and open a cereal shop in the future. 

In ten years, she hopes to supply fish to hotels.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a freezer.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: C7852 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years-old and married with four children between the ages of two and seven years.  Joseph is the leader of a group which is called Abisunganye. This group contains five people: one woman and four men.  Joseph owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products.  Joseph has ten years experience and his shop is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Joseph and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses.  Joseph and his group hope to use the loan to increase profits and plan to reinvest this in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma E. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Lerma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lerma owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services on television set, digital video players & components for local community members. Lerma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lerma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Lerma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed like heating rod gun & glue stick  gun. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lerma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed like heating rod gun &  glue stick gun

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet S., 27, is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of $3 per day. 

The family has to spend $11 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $20 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Josephine Khakuyia

texts.en:
Josphine Khakuyia I. is  27 years old. She is married to Dennis, who owns a barber shop. Together they have  two children. Josphine has been a green grocer owner for the last two years. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI.  This is  her first loan from KADET.  Josephine plans use the loan to purchase vegetables, potatoes and fruits to sell in her business. With the anticipated profits she plans to open a food café. 

Her dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: To purchase e vegetables, potatoes and fruits

loans.name: Nanita

texts.en: Nanita E. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Nanita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nanita runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Nanita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Nanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nanita is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas W. K. is a married man. His wife is a business woman and they have seven children aged between twenty one years old and three years old. His business is located at a very busy market known as Kongowea in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

He sells fruits mainly water melons to the local people. He has been a fruit vendor for the last ten years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and dishonest customers who purchase on credit and fail to honor their request. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to increase the stock of water melons to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to o be able to supply fruits in wholesale to all major hotels in Mombasa in the future. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy and reliable.

loans.use: Water melons

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Saum has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for 7 years.  She also has a second business selling clothes  

To help expand her business, Saum has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saum hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Saum hopes to own a plot of land and build a house. Saum is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to get more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and clothes for resale

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a thirty year-old, single mother living with her parents in Fort Portal Uganda.  She takes care of her parents and child, and her dream is to buy land and construct a house.  She decorates at parties and also has a poultry farm, which has helped her in providing for the family.  Joselyne needs the money to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed .

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es: Javier de Jesús tiene más de 10 años en su negocio, por lo que se siente muy independiente al obtener este medio de ingreso. Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos, pues tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos de medicamentos, el vive en el municipio de dolores en donde la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el precio de sus medicamentos son muy favorables. Con este crédito el comprara vitaminas, suplementos, pastillas, pomadas, entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Javier de Jesús has spent more than 10 years in his business, so he feels very independent having this source of income. His business is selling natural medicines. He has a wide variety of customers who place orders for different medicines. He lives in Dolores municipality where the majority of his customers know that his prices are very good. With this loan he will purchase vitamins, supplements, pills, creams, and other products they request from him.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, supplements, pills, creams, and other products

loans.name: Inaydina

texts.es: Inaydina, D. 26 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Francisco D. 30 años y su querido hijo Antonio D. 04 años D. edad, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Inaydina  y su pareja, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso D. su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinD. a sus sembríos D. cacao, café y hojas D. coca, dependerá L. calidad D. los productos que obtenga, pero para el tiempo D. cosecha necesita del apoyo D. los jornaleros, quienes le ayudan en las extracciones D. los productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta los centros D. acopio ubicado en L. ciudad D. San Francisco, que es el lugar donD. los venD., ya que los sacos en donD. lleva los productos son muy pesados; con el crédito solicitado adquirirá semillas D. café y repoblara sus sembríos. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas D. café, con lo cual espera asegurar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
Inaydina, age 26, is a cheerful hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Francisco, age 30, and their beloved four-year-old son Antonio who is the reason behind all of her efforts. The crops that Inaydina and her partner cultivate with great effort have helped them make progress in life. Every morning they start the work on their land because they know that the care they proviD. to their cacao, coffee, and coca leaf crops will determine the quality of the final product. During the harvest season, she needs the assistance of workers who help with collecting the produce. What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops because she feels happy when her plants grow to be large and fruitful. Inaydina has been farming for five years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying her harvested products to the collection centers in the city of San Francisco, the place where she sells. The sacks of produce can be very heavy.

The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire coffee seedlings in order to replenish her crops. Going forward, she hopes to improve her products in order to obtain better prices. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Inaydina knows that she must submit all of her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is a very supportive and responsible member of her Communal Bank. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to purchase coffee seedlings in hopes of securing her future harvests.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Maame Adjoa

texts.en:
Maame Adjoa A. sells soap and ointment at Eguafo near Elmina. 

Educated up to senior high school, she has been in the business for five years.

The income that Maame earns helps supplement her husband’s income. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. 

She plans to grow her business by producing a larger volume of products for sale. With her loan from Kiva, she’ll be able to purchase more palm fruit and other ingredients to make more soap and ointment. 

Maame intends to reinvest the additional profits back into her business for further growth. 

Maame is pictured next to a pile of palm fruit. Palm oil, which is extracted from the fruit, is a key ingredient for making soap and ointment.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and other ingredients to make more soap and ointment.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Binta B.. She is married and has three children aged 19, 16, and 13 years. 

In 2005, Binta B. established her plastic slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she wanted to support her husband in contributing financially to the running of the home. "I'm self reliant, independent and I am not a burden to my husband," said Binta. She opens her business seven days a week and 10 hours a day. 

She needs a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to buy more stock. In the future, Binta plans to expand her business and become a supplier to other traders and also to have a house for herself. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of plastic slippers and sandals for her business

loans.name: Pea

texts.en: Mrs. Pea, 46, is married to Nem Loy, 56, who catches fresh fish in and around the lakes of his community. Mrs. Pea sells the  fresh fish that her husband and other fishermen catch for reasonable prices. Presently, she also sells some merchandise around her village for extra income. Because of her old broken motorbike, her fish selling business has been affected.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Pea is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Janyl is the leader of this group. She is 26 years old and married to a mechanic. Together they are bringing up two daughters, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). Five years ago, Janyl saved 15,000 KGS and used it to purchase livestock. She currently breeds livestock that she resells at a higher price after fattening. In this way, she earns additional money to meet her family's needs.  

Janyl is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock animals for breeding. She hopes that her loan will help her to develop her business. In the future, Janyl wants to give her children a good education.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.es:
La señora Mercedez de 47 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo varón, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, jugos y terere de forma ambulante de hace más de 13 años en la terminal de ómnibus de la ciudad.
Desde muy joven le gusto el tema de las ventas, ella comenta que con mucho esfuerzo está logrando tener todas la comodidades en su pequeño hogar, actualmente con la buena venta que realiza ya tiene otros ideales como de contar con una casilla de ventas con mas mercaderías.
La Sra. se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella no teme al trabajo y esta segura de que con la ayuda del prestamo podra cumplir muchas de sus espectativas.
Solicita el crédito para poder cumplir su sueño y mediante esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedez, 47, is a single mother and has a son.  She has been a street vendor for over 13 years in the omnibus terminal where she sells sweets, juices and tereré (a type of tea).

She has always been interested in sales from the time she was very young.  With a lot of effort she is able to have all the comforts in her small home.  With sales going well now she is thinking of other projects such as owning her own stall where she can sell more merchandise.

Mercedez defines herself as hard-working and a fighter.  She is not afraid of work and is sure that with the help of the loan she will be able to meet her goals.  She is requesting a loan to reach this goal and improve family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy sweets to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Lilian has a retail shop that sells dried fish like pinikas. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish.

Lilian is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish

loans.name: Kpelegueba

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de pagnes et des bassines à AGOE, Kpelegueba achète depuis 1999 à Lomé. Pour aider son mari électricien dans les charges du foyer, assurer un avenir radieux à ses 02 enfants et avoir plus tard sa propre boutique, elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises (pagnes et bassines).
texts.en: Selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and basins door-to-door in AGOE, Kpelegueba has been making her purchases in Lomé since 1999. To help her husband, an electrician, with household expenses and to ensure a brilliant future for her two children, as well as to have her own shop in the future, she is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise (pagne cloth and basins).

loans.use: to buy cloth and basins

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 7 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, este negocio surgió por necesidad  y lo realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 4 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como cremas, lociones, talcos, shampoo, entre otros que son demandados por los clientes, con este préstamo fortalecerá el negocio y obtendrá una mejor rentabilidad.
Las aspiraciones de Reina es tener un local fijo, donde ofrecer la mercadería, ofreciendo un servicio mejor y con productos al alcance de los clientes, esta idea surge por la iniciativa de comprarse a largo plazo un vehículo, el cual lo puede obtener por medio de mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Reina has a house of her own.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 13, 7 and 2 years old.  She sells cosmetics. The business arose because of need and she’s been working door-to-door for four years.

She is asking for a loan to buy products like creams, lotions, talc and shampoo, among others that are in highest demand by customers.  She will strengthen the business with this loan and will attain better profitability.

Reina’s hopes are that she will have a fixed locale to sell her merchandise and to offer better service and products that her customers can afford.  This idea arises from her desire to purchase a car in the long run that she would be able to do through better profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 60 years old and married, with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Tita has a video games business in the Philippines. 

Tita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and an additional unit of video games. Tita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future,  she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and additional unit of video games

loans.name: Gemime

texts.fr:
Gemime est agri-éleveuse. Elle est mariée, Elle a 30 ans, Elle a 3 enfants de 1 à 5 ans et 1 enfant scolarisé. Sa niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire. 

C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour renforcer son élevage des abeilles. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de renforcer l’élevage des abeilles pour avoir un grand nombre de clients des miels qui s’approvisionnent chez elle. Dans les prochaines années, Gemime voudrait devenir une grande apicultrice dans son secteur. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gemime raises livestock.  She is married, is 30 years old, and has three children ranging in age from 1 to 5 years, one of whom attends school.  She has 6 years of secondary schooling. 

This is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She is going to use this loan to build up her beekeeping business.  Her strategy for growing her business is to increase the number of bees she has and to build a large base of customers who get their honey from her.  In the next few years, Gemime would like to become a successful  beekeeper in her region.  With her profits, she plans to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to build up her beekeeing business.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su  artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tienen seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, solo uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante aunque ya casi no trabaja ya que está enfermo.

 La señora Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa  en la cual vende productos como arroz, azúcar, granos, detergentes, legumbres, carne, pescado, pollo entre otros productos de primera necesidad, también hace poco empezó a vender cilindros de gas y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que no hay muchos lugares donde se puedan comprar este producto tan necesario en los hogares de los ecuatorianos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda y sobretodo cilindros de gas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y colaboración del grupo. 

Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio ya que le encanta las ventas y atender su tienda.
texts.en:
