The Communal Bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Toward Development with Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. For example, its straw hats are known within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Rosa. She is 70 years old, married, and has six children who are all grown and independent. Only one of them still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant, but he hardly works because of illness.

Sra. Rosa has a food store in her house where she sells products such as rice, sugar, grain, detergents, legumes, meat, fish, chicken, and other basic products. She also began selling cylinders of natural gas. Rosa says that her sales have been good because there are not many places where people can buy this product that is a necessity for many Ecuadorian homes. She works every day from 6am to 8pm. Rosa has been in business for more than 30 years and has done very well. Her son and her husband help her with the business.

This new loan will be invested in the purchase of basic necessity products to restock her store as well as cylinders of natural gas. Rosa has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys the help and collaboration of her group. Her dreams include continuing in her business because she enjoys making sales and managing her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessity products and cylinders of natural gas.

loans.name: Ave-Gnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE-GNON est formé de trois  personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Viviane est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Paul. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Viviane et sa famille habitent ensemble. Viviane n’a pas été à l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Viviane prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Viviane achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. La clientèle de Viviane devient de plus en plus grande, et Viviane désir rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Viviane et les autres membres du groupe AVE-GNON se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un autre crédit.
texts.en:
AVE-GNON Group is made up off three women who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Viviane, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Viviane, age 43, is married to a driver named Paul. The couple has four school-attending children to support. Viviane and her family live together. She never attended school.

To provide for herself and her family, she prepares food (rice, corn paste) that she sells at her home. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's town. Her clientele is increasing, and Viviane wants to bolster her business in order to better meet customer demand.

Lacking financial means to make their dream come true, Viviane and the other members of the group approached ALIDé in order to seek a loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de odontología, ella tiene un consultorio donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar su consultorio odontológico. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su consultorio para comprar sillas.   
                                                                                    
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Soledad is a member of the communal lender “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO” in Cusco.  Soledad is 31 and has one child with her husband.  She maintains an odontological practice, serving clients from 8:00 a.m to 9:00 p.m. and hopes to grow the business to better provide for her son.  She seeks this loan to better equip her office with chairs.  Soledad is pleased to have access to credit and is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su consultorio para comprar sillas.

loans.name: Vitaliya

texts.ru:
Виталия – замужем, у нее двое детей. Она родом из Хуста, Западная Украина. Виталия зарабатывает на жизнь реализацией детской одежды и обуви. В этом бизнесе она занята уже 6 лет. На сегодняшний день у нее в товаре – 30 000 гривен. Репутация у Виталии – отменная, и как у человека, и как у предпринимателя.   

Виталия планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен в приобретение мебели для открытия магазина детской одежды и обуви. На свадьбу отец Виталии подарил ей с мужем дом. Этот дом они переоборудовали под коммерческое помещение и стали сдавать его в аренду банку «Надра». Совсем недавно к зданию банка они пристроили небольшое помещение, которое и собираются использовать для работы своего небольшого магазинчика. Виталия планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес и улучшать условия проживания за счет получаемого дохода. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vitaliya is married and has two children.  She is from Khoost, Western Ukraine.  Vitaliya earns a living by selling children's clothing and shoes.  She has been involved in this business for six years.  Today, she has 30,000 invested in her merchandise.  Vitaliya has an excellent reputation both as a person and as an entrepreneur.  Vitaliya plans to invest the 15,000 hryvnia Kiva loan into the to purchase furniture for the opening of children's clothing and shoes store.  Vitaliya's father gave her and her husband a house as a wedding gift.  They re-purposed this house into a commercial space and started to lease it to the "Nadra" bank.  They recently added a small wing to the bank building, which they plan to use for their small store.  Vitaliya plans to develop her business further and to improve her living conditions due to the obtained profit.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the opening of chidlren's clothing and shoes store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. Her educational background is up to the junior high level. Margaret is a baker at Takoradi. She bakes bread and moves from one place to another in the early hours of the morning to sell to her customers. The loan which is going to provide additional income will be used to purchase flour, sugar, salt and others to use in baking so that Margaret can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and others to bake to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is 31 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.
 
Cherlie has a firewood business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase materials for the construction.
 
Cherlie has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction

loans.name: Nzuve

texts.en:
Nzuve is a 43-year-old married man with three children, all of whom attend school. His wife Prisila is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Nzuve has operated a retail shop for the past six years; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces the major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a motorbike for his new transportation business. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his new transportation business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 59 years old and blessed with nine children. He wants his children to pursue their studies so they can earn their degrees and become professionals someday. But nowadays, it is difficult for him to finance their education due to the high cost of commodities, school fees, and transportation. To lessen his burden, his four children have volunteered to stop attending school so they can help him with his business.

Gregorio wants to improve his farming business in order to provide a better standard of living and earn enough income to support the education of all of his children. Due to financial constraints, he is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his crops. He believes that through patience and hard work they will make the business practical and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his crop.

loans.name: Jamala

texts.en:
Jamala is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of six and 16. Two of them go to school. 

Jamala runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 10 years. He has one employee. Jamala heard about Finance Sudan from his fellow clients in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase items like milk, coffee, Tang juice, sugar, Nomi and others. Jamala has no source of income other than this business.  

In five years time, Jamala hopes to change his business to a big wholesale store.

His major challenges include high rate of outgoing money because his wife is not employed.

Jamala says that Finance Sudan Should continue in the country.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, coffee, Tang juice, sugar, Nomi, and others.

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo is an industrious farmer whose main concern is to improve his family's living conditions and to help his three children finish their studies. He is 39 years old, and has been operating his farming business for seven years, earning only PHP 20,000 during the last cropping season.

He used his income to purchase the daily needs of his family and for his children's allowances. This causes him not to save for his farm, even though farming requires greater capital input for him to gain a good harvest. Because of this, he is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland. 

He hopes to make his business more developed and profitable for the welfare of his family, even with the hardships he bumps into just to keep up his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 45 años, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposo Jorge de 45 años en su propia casa ya que todos sus hijos 05 ejercieron una carrera y son independientes. Olga, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo pudo educar a sus 05 hijos y sacar profesional a cada uno de ellos. La bodega de Olga es muy frecuentado por sus compradores por el buen trato que brinda. Apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 08 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más mercadería  para su negocio. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias comprando bebidas, golosinas y frutas para hacer su rica cremolada. Este es crédito numero 02 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer  a su banca comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Olga, age 45, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Jorge, age 45, in their own home. All five of her children are independent and have a career. Olga is an industrious woman who worked hard to educate her five children and help them to become professionals. Her store is frequented by customers because of the good service that she provides. The doors of her business are opened very early in order to receive her first customers. They know that she offers a variety of merchandise in her store, so they do not hesitate to buy from her. What Olga enjoys most about her work is being able to converse with her customers. One of the skills that she uses is persuading her customers to buy more products. Olga has been in business for eight years and says the most difficult part is being on her feet for almost the entire day. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her business. Over time, she plans to increase her earnings by purchasing beverages, candies, and fruits for making her delicious smoothies.

This is her second loan with MFP. Olga is pleased to know that she can obtain financial support. She feels secure in knowing that she can buy more inventory and is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank. Her loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy products to restock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en: Sifa is a student who has dream as a nurse, she taking school in Bandung now, because In Indonesia if want to be a nurse, so we must graduate university. and that's her reason want to be a nurse. but she has trouble by a costs so her parent join be a komida clients, and get some loan for her school and right now she just waiting because her dream becoming true.

loans.use: To Pay for Certificate

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Caroline (pictured above) from Kakiptui, Kericho area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Caroline is 41 years old and a proud mother of 3 angelic-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. In addition to doing some small business, Caroline is a very hardworking farmer. She has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Caroline practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Caroline has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest lately because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds, and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds, so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Caroline will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Using this loan, Caroline will be able to expand her horticulture business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Caroline will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. You can help Caroline with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to her and her family.
Her dream is to have a large horticulture farm, to live comfortably and be very happy with her three children.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Moldova is a small country and most people rely on public or group transportation. Both people who offer transportation with min-buses (called Rutieras) and those who have private cars need affordable service options to keep their vehicles working. Recently many in the area of Ungheni have come to rely on Servotest, a car repair station owned by Vasile L., a local entrepreneur with 3 years of experience as a mechanic. The five-bay garage offers “anything and everything a car needs,” including oil changes, tune-ups and more extensive repairs. In addition to serving individuals, Vasile has secured auto service contracts with many businesses in the area, such as banks and delivery services. He has just started opening an auto parts store as well, located in the same building and providing anything from air filters to shock absorbers for customers who like to do their own repairs. He would like to stock more items in the store and also to purchase new equipment for the workshop, including a diagnostics machine that will help identify complex problems. As more people working abroad return to Moldova(estimation of 20% of the population work abroad) with late-model cars Vasile wants to be ready to provide high-tech service!

loans.use: Auto repair equipment and parts purchases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther Magiri intends to purchase five bags of cereals

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania has had her small business selling gifts, perfumes, sodas and sweets from her house for 6 years. She began her business with savings that her husband gave her in order to see what they were able to invest, and in this way they have generated more additional income. Tania works in her shop from 6am to 9pm every day of the week.

Tania tells us that she is asking for a loan in order to secure the growth of her business. Demand is growing, thanks to the fact that it’s the beginning of the school year and so she needs to buy a variety of school supplies, presents and other products that her customers are requesting. Also Tania wants to renovate her shop in order to present a better image and offer abetter service to her customers.

Tania is 31 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are studying. Her husband helps her with the business, as do her children in attending customers. They are all confident that the loan will help them a lot, as they will be able to expand their business and generate better profits, which will allow them to continue improving their home and business site.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Tania tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de regalos, perfumes, soda, confites en su domicilio desde hace 6 años. Se inicio con su negocio con ahorros que esposo le dio para que vea en que lo podía invertir y de esta manera generar otros ingresos adicionales. Tania atiende su negocio desde las 6: AM a 21: PM todos los días de la semana.

Tania nos dice que solicita un préstamo para poder seguir incrementando su negocio. Su demanda se aumentado debido a que es época escolar y necesita comprar variedad en útiles escolares, regalos y otros productos que sus clientes le están solicitando. Además Tania desea adecuar su local para dar una mejor imagen y atención a sus clientes.

Tania tiene 31 años 4 hijos y todos estudian. Esposo la apoya en su negocio al igual que sus hijos en la atención a sus clientes. Ellos tienen la confianza que el crédito les ayudara en mucho porque incrementaran su negocio y generara mayores ingresos. Permitiendo seguir adecuando su vivienda y local.

loans.use: Rennovate shop site and increase stock inventory

loans.name: Flora Beatriz

texts.pt:
Flora Beatriz M. was born on the 3rd of November, 1974, in Maputo. She lived part of her childhood with her parents. In 1987, her father died, and she was now under the care of her mother. She attended school until the 7th grade. While she studied, she also managed a business. At 16 years old she became pregnant, which forced her to discontinue her studies and focus on the business to gaurentee sustenance to her child, especially since her boyfriend had abandoned her. In 1991, she became pregnant a second time, birthing twins.

She had been in the business world for a long time. When she was young, her mother gave her money to start her own business. She has built a house alongside her business, and she lives currently with her three children. Through a friend, she came to know Hluvuku and asked for a loan of 675 dollars to purchase products to strengthen her business capital. In the future, she intends to construct a house to rent becasue she considers this a secure investment.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora Beatriz M., nascido no dia 3 de Novembro de 1974 em Maputo, passou uma parte da sua infância junto dos seus pais . Em 1987 faleceu o pai ficando sob cuidados da Mãe, estudou até 7ªclasse .Enquanto estudava tambem fazia negócio, aos 16 anos fica grávida facto que lhe fez deixar de estudar para se dedicar apenas no negócio para garantir o sustento do filho já que o homem que lhe engravidara já a tinha abandonado. Em 1991 fica novamente grávida com outro homem tendo em 2000 nascido gêmeos.

Segundo ela, entrou no mundo de negócio a muito tempo e ainda nova sua mãe foi quem lhe deu dinheiro para iniciar o negócio.Tendo construído uma casa do tipo dois na base do negócio, vive actualmente com os seus três filhos. Atravês de uma amiga ficou a saber da existência da Hluvuku tendo, tendo solicitado um empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de produtos o que vai reforçar o capital de trabalho. Futuramente pretende construir mais uma casa para arendar porque considera que é um investimento seguro.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Shikhzade

texts.en:
Shikhzade has been a poultry farmer for the past four years. He is 57 years old, married, and has four children. They all live in the town of Khachmaz.

In his current business, Shikhzade buys chickens and raises them for poultry sales. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy additional hens and chickens to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase hens and chickens

loans.name: Ratna Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Maiya N. is 57 years old and lives in Dhalko in the Kathmandu district.  She lives with her husband, Mr. Karna Bhadur, and two sons. Her husband is a laborer. Her older son is a house painter and her younger son is illiterate and has no work. 
Mrs. N. sells greens and other vegetables in a footpath market. Their condition is not good. To overcome this problem she sells vegetables in the footpath. 
Now she is asking for her first loan of Rs10,000 (US$175) to buy vegetables, because in Nepal green vegetables are very popular among the food items.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gulbakhor

texts.en: Gulbakhor M. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 3 children.  Mrs. M. has been a successful, strongly motivated client of MicroInvest since 2006. Her credit history makes her eleigible for larger loans. She works in the joint-stock company "Navbakhor" making winter wear. Gulbakhor M. developed her own patterns and used special accessories to make the clothing more individual. She has the a loyal clientele of long standing. She has a lot of ideas on how to make her work more efficient and how to broaden the product line. She would like to modernize her business and requests a loan of $725 to buy a computerized sewing machine. Her dream is to open her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26 year old father who lives with his family in Beirut. Mahmoud is an independent and ambitious young man who owns and runs his own butcher shop. He provides for his family with the earnings from his business. This is the first time Mahmoud is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara A. lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 4 children. She is 35 years old but has significant business experience (about 8 years). Mrs. A. is engaged in the business of selling children's clothes and shoes. She trades in the flea bazaar where she has her own trade outlet, a wide assortment of goods, and many repeat/loyal customers. Now Mrs. A. seeks a loan of 1600 TJS ($475) to purchase new goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Zinnat

texts.ru:
Currently, is the time to buy and sell cattle. Zinnat S. has one calf, she would like to purchase a cow because cattle is inexpensive now. Zinnat began this business because her husband was rearing animals. Then, he found a different source of income and she began to rear animals. Zinnat began taking care of animals when her husband had this business.

In the future the cow will give milk and she will be able to sell it. Besides, it will be possible to produce yogurts, and this will provide additional income. Zinnat and her husband have two children who help in this business. The children help transfer milk and sell it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

В настоящее время сезон купли продажи скота. У Шокировой Зиннат есть теленок, она хочет купить к нему еще и корову, так как сейчас скот очень дешевый. Она этот бизнес начала с того, что ее муж занимался скотоводством, но у него появился еще один источник дохода, по этому он передал бизнес скотов Зиннат, она с начала его бизнеса ухаживала за скотом. Со временем корова будет давать молоко, и она сможет продавать молоко. Кроме этого можно будет изготавливать молочные и кисломолочные продуктом, и это будет дополнительным источником дохода. У них двое детей они помогают в этом деле, дети развозят молоко и продают.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Osadara

texts.en: Osadara O.'s  business is distinguished from other shops because of her colorful arrangement of food stuffs, ranging from thin tomatoes, sachet water etc. She also has a deep freezer which is used for selling frozen food like turkey, fish and chickens which has allowed her to meet the demand of her numerous customers. She acquired the skill of trading for 6 months. Osadara has being borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she has beeen in her business since 2007. She requests the sum of $1200 to enable her to buy an additional deep freezer and generator so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy one Freezer and one Generator

loans.name: Jesucita's Group

texts.en:
Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica are all members of the same village bank at FINCA. All three of them agree that being members of FINCA has reinforced the values of punctuality, responsibility, saving; values that they believe are important in the growth of their businesses.

Alejandrina is forty-two years old and has four children -- three boys and one girl -- ranging from six to twenty three years old. She was a member of FINCA in 1993, left for two years, and rejoined in 1995. She has been receiving support from FINCA ever since. Alejandrina has a business selling all kinds of vegetables from a stand in the local market. She used to sell vegetables in her village in the country before moving to the capital city of Ayacucho, Huamanga.

Jesusita is 33 years old and has 2 children, a boy of 8 and a girl of 16. Jesusita has been a part of FINCA for 18 years. Jesusita has a little store where she sells food staples, such as pasta, grains, soft drinks and candy.

Angelica is 26 years old and has a new, 10-month-old baby girl. She recently joined FINCA in December of 2007. Before moving to Ayacucho, she was living in Lima and studying to become a nurse, but moved to Ayacucho with her new husband to raise a family here. Now she serves lunch from her house as her business.

Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica need loans of 750, 900, and 600 soles (3 soles = 1 dollar) to buy more vegetables, rice, potatoes, pasta, lemons and other foods to expand their businesses.

Alejandrina, Jesusita and Angelica all have dreams of someday improving their houses. They dream that their children will become professionals. Angelica also plans to complete her nursing degree.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, rice, potatoes, pasta, lemons and other foods to expand their businesses

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea U., 44, is a widow with one son and three daughters, who lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. The other three children live under her custody, in school or assisting her in doing farming.

Mrs. Kunthea has been farming since 1998. She grows jasmine flowers and bananas on the farm near her home. Beside doing farming, she also sells jasmine flowers and bananas at the market in Phnom Penh. Some she buys from farmers in the village for resale; some are from her own farm.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract. She needs to pay money to the farmers first before the harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract

loans.name: Marie Brigitte

texts.fr:
Marie Brigitte N., 50, is a divorced mother of six and has been a member of the Néma 2 village bank for five years. She would like to buy palm oil, honey, lemons and undergarments (bras and slips). She buys the palm oil and undergarments in Guinea and then sells them in Cap Skiring. Marie also works as a maid. She would like to develop her business to better cover her family’s food, health and education expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie Brigitte N., 50 ans, divorcée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Néma 2 depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du miel, du citron et du linge de corps (soutien gorge et slip). Elle achète l’huile et le linge de corps en guinée pour revendre au Cap Skiring. Marie travaille aussi comme domestique. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer la prise en charge des besoins de nourriture, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of honey, palm oil, lemons and undergarments

loans.name: Nakaweesi, Tusuubira Group

texts.en:
Milly N. is a mother of 4 children. In the photo she is holding her last born. She is 33 years old and the leader of this group. She has had a retail shop in Lugazi since 1999. She has been a client of Pearl Microfinance for 5 years.

In her shop, Milly sells sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, hair chemicals, braids and clothes of various types. Her husband has his own businesses, but he usually helps her in her shop on busy days, like weekends and public holidays.

Because Milly has many products in her shop, she has won many customers. Most of all, she has succeeded because she is careful with her funds and plans accordingly. She does not entertain unnecessary spending. Milly now needs a loan to help her restock her shop with more products to sell.

loans.use: Milly needs a loan to help her buy more sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, hair chemicals, braids and children's clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. Amin and lives in a small city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for 25 years. She has seven children: two sons and five daughters. Her eldest son sews clothes. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has raised buffalo and sold their milk for the last 5 years. Ruqaiya baji is a housewife and prefers doing household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her previous four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, switch boards, tubes) for her electrical shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a wood-cutting machine. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy material (kettle, milk, tea, and cups) for her tea stall. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo to increase milk production and sales

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is 59 years old and is a mother of two children. She lives in Baku city. Irina has been in the laundry business for five years. She needs a loan of $825 to buy the necessary things to improve the output of her laundry business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving her laundry business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 22 y 11 años, su esposo trabaja como taxista. Ella inicio hace 2 años su negocio ya que siempre ha trabajado en venta de productos por catalogo después de un tiempo decidió cambiar de giro y empezó a elaborar y vender gorditas de azúcar ya que siempre le ha gustado cocinar así que empezó en su casa preparándolas como le ha ido muy bien ahora quiere dedicarse a venderlas en los mercados.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para establecer su negocio en el mercado y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has 3 children who are 25, 22 and 11 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She began her business 2 years ago working in catalog sales, but after awhile she decided to make a change and began to make and sell sugar “gorditas” (sweet tortillas, popular in Monterrey). As Isabel has always liked to cook, she started preparing gorditas at home and since she did well with them she now wants to sell them at the markets.

Isabel needs to borrow $375 in order to establish her business in the market and to get more clients. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish her business in a market

loans.name: Caren

texts.es: La señora Caren, de 31 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, vive con su esposo quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. La venta de productos de belleza es la actividad en la que desde hace cuatro años atrás la señora Caren se encaminó, ella deja sus productos al contado y al crédito, los que vende a través de un catálogo proporcionado por la línea de belleza. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conocer mucha gente y muchos lugares, le es rentable porque desde sus inicias ha contado  con  un gran número de clientes que requieren de estos productos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. El dinero será invertido en la compra de una vitrina y más productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Caren, 31 years old, is the mother of two children, lives with her husband who agrees with her proposal. selling beauty products is the activity which for four years Caren has engaged in. She gets her products on credit, which she sells from a catalog from the beauty line. What she likes about her work is that she knows a lot of people and a lot of places, which is beneficial because from the start she ha made contact with a large number of customers who require these products. This is the first time she is asking for a loan with MFP. The money will be invested in buying more beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of products she sells

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith makes a living selling vegetables and spices -- such as tomatoes, peppers, onions and other items -- in the local market of Ashaiman, a suburb of the city of Tema in Ghana. She is 28 years old, married and has one child who is currently in school. She travels to nearby faming communities to procure supplies directly from farmers. This allows her to avoid middlemen who resell to traders like her at higher price. Judith does not have adequate working capital to support her business, which is why she sometimes obtains her supplies on credit and makes payment after sales, with lender's charges added.  

Judith has applied for a loan so that she can increase her supplies of vegetables and spices. By doing this, she also hopes to increase her profit margin so that she can have more money to support her family and fund her child's education.  Judith is a member of an organization called the Knowledge Trust Group. Members of this group help one another repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is widowed, 45, and lives in Tomnup village in Kandal Province. She sells a variety of food, such as cooked rice with pork, fried potato and banana, and boiled eggs. She has been selling food since 2005 and earns around $4 per day. Her business is going well due to the location near the crowded area, her delicious food, and reasonable prices. She has one son who works selling clothes and earns $5 per day toward supporting the family.

Because of her success and growing business, she needs to expand to increase profits. Therefore, she requests a loan to purchase more meat and raw ingredients to make more food to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more raw ingredients and meat to make more food to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Tiessiri (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 43ans et 03 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Bougoula ville un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région du Mali).
 Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’esence, de chaussures et  la restauration.
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été bien dénoués.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1 sac de 100kg de riz pour faire la restauration, 4 boutielles de parfum , 10kg de  4kg de et autres pour la fabrique d’encens, 2 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et 1bariles et ½ d’essence. Elles   s’approvisionnement à Sikasso ville et dans les localités environnantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupat au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 32.000fcfa par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Tiessiri group (all married) have an average age of 43 and 3 children, on average. They live in traditional families in Bougoula township, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (3rd region of Mali).

They have various businesses, among others selling gasoline, shoes, and food service. They are on their 5th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan they expect to buy 3 packets of condiments, 1 sack of 100 kg of rice to be cooked and sold, 4 bottles of perfume, 14 kg of raw materials used to make incense, 2 dozen pairs of plastic shoes, and one and a half barrels of gasoline. They do their buying in the town of Sikasso and surrounding localities.

The merchandise is sold at the market and in the neighborhoods to a clientele composed generally of women and mostly for cash. They each expect to make 32,000 F CFA per month profit of which part will be used for the needs of their families and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Bernarda es casada, tiene 49 años, dos hijos de 26 y 24 años que trabajan. 
Hace ocho años Bernarda vio que por la escuela donde sus hijos habían estudiaban no había librería, entonces ella decidió alquilar un local y poner una librería, se llama Librería  LUCY, empezó con pocas cosas, actualmente sus hijos le ayudan cada día.
Bernarda  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar útiles escolares, papel, cuadernos, lapiceros, de diferentes marcas. 
En Finca aprendió a través de las charlas  de negocio  cómo  administrar mejor su librería, le gusta la solidaridad entre las socias y ha hecho buenas amigas. 
El sueño de Bernarda es que el negocio crezca y dejar el negocio a sus hijos, y poner otro negocio.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. Bernarda is married, 49 years old, and has two children, 26 and 24 years old, who work. Eight years ago Bernarda noticed that there was no bookstore near the school where her children had studied, so she decided to rent a place and start a bookstore called Librería LUCY. She started with just a few things, and now her children help her every day. Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens. At Finca, she learned from business talks how to run her bookstore better, she likes the support she gets from the members, and she has made good friends. Bernarda's dream is for the business to grow so she can leave it to her children and start a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is a sari-sari (grocery) store owner. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, a town of 21,190 people. The place is agricultural and most livelihoods are from farming and livestock. Tessie is aware of the global crisis in most countries today including the Philippines. That is why she insists on having a business to earn a living for the family. She is 44 years old and still single.

She is asking for a loan of PHP23,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store, and this will help her store to expand.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start a business and fight poverty. They not only provide credit to their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Grace A., 21 years old, is married with 1 kid.  She lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City.  Her husband is a painter.  The couple could not obtain a high paying job so they decided to venture into sari-sari (variety) store business, but there was no capital at hand.  With determination and courage they applied for membership at Paglaum MPC, having heard of its loan windows.  In her desire to help her husband, she applied for Php 14,900 from the cooperative.  Their neighbors became their customers, and eventually they could even display their products in the public market. 

The small business is going so well that she decided to expand. Mrs. A. has been able to pay her previous loan in a timely fashion, and is a member in good standing.  She has high hopes that God will bless their business, and that they will hopefully own a bigger store when their profits allow.  In the future, she wants to see her child finish good education.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: 5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Chuyền

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bibirachab

texts.ru: Махмуродова Бибирачаб живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает на стройке. Бибирачаб с мужем имеет торговую точку на рынке "Сафина". На рынке торгует сама Бибирачаб. Она торгует материалами. Этим видом деятельности она работает более 20 лет. Т.к. заработная плата мужа не хватает, они решили начать свой бизнес. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы купить материалы, т.е. пополнить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Bibirachab Mahmurodova lives in the Rudaki district. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Bibirachab and her husband have a retail outlet at the Safina market. Bibirachab is the one selling fabrics at the market. She has been working in this field over 20 years. Because her husband’s salary was not enough to support the family, they decided to start their own business. Bibirachab wants to obtain the loan in order to purchase fabrics to add to her merchandise assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrics purchase

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive en casa propia en la calle Alberto Ostria de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; en la casa instaló un Snack, lugar donde vende Sándwiches, café, y comida ya que en el lugar hay una parada de Minibuses, el negocio marcha bien motivo por el cual ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento, arena y cerámica para el piso, como también cubrir el costo de la mano de obra, y de esta manera ampliar su negocio y tener mayor clientela, pues esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pago muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in her own house on Alberto Ostria Street, Alto Soposachi zone, in the city of La Paz. She set up a snack stand in her home. She sells sandwiches, coffee, and meals. There is a bus stop there; the business is going well. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, tile for the floor, and labor costs to expand her business and have more customers. This business is her only source of income. She is a client of Impro, and she has a good history of payment. She is, therefore, able to have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, tile, and pay for labor to expand her snack stand

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 25 year-old woman living in the town of Gia Lộc. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, L. owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,300,000 VND a month.

In 2008, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. L. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 227080750.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites O., 39 years old, is very optimistic about life. She started a fishing business with a single unit pumpboat. Together with her husband, they pursued this venture despite the odds. Today, their business is growing and they hope to have more units of pumpboat soon. 

The driving force making the couple strive harder is their five children. They want to see all of them finish their college degrees and have a better life in the future.

Presently, Marites is asking the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for a Php 10,000.00 loan that will be used to purchase fishing net. She trusts CEVI because this institution offers their clients a variety of good services.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline W. is a married woman aged 34 years old who is a born-again Christian. She has two children who both go to school.

Caroline plans to use the money from this loan to buy additional stock for her general store, including bags of sugar, crates of soda, mineral water, cooking fat and other household items.

Caroline's dream is to one day own a big supermarket, hence creating more job opportunities for other people where she lives. She also plans to be a supplier of household goods, and hopes this will boost her profit and enable her buy a plot of land on which she could build her own house.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy addititonal stock for a general store such as bags of sugar, crates of soda, etc.

loans.name: Yousos

texts.en:
Mr. Yousos M., age 37, is shown in the picture with his wife, Mrs. Mary You, age 36.  They were married in 2000 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yousos has been a fisherman since he was young, a skill he learned from his parents. He fishes from the Mekong River and sells to the wholesaler in his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. 

He is applying for a loan of $600 to purchase a dragging machine and fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a dragging machine and fishing materials for his fishing business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Hope village bank. She is 34 years old and has one son who is 12 years old and studies in the local private school.

Amelia studied technical nursing and did her residency but stopped because she became pregnant and then dedicated herself to her daughter. Two years ago she decided to start selling beauty products via catalogue. Four months ago she decided to study baking in the Occupational Education Center of Government. She takes night classes and enjoys it because she is learning how to make different pastries and sweets. Amelia says that since she joined FINCA, she has developed personally and her self-esteem is high. She also says she has become economically independent and does not depend on her husband.

Amelia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy beauty products at discount rates so that she can resell them for a profit. Her dream is to have a bakery and she is confident that she will see her dream come true.

loans.use: buy beauty products at discount rates so that she can resell them for a profit

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en: Afia is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. Afia is a trader. She trades in cosmetics and local soap production. She is the leader of a trust bank group called God’s Mercy. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new chairs, tables and utensils

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander M. is from the village of Valencia, Bukidnon. He is 47 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Alexander owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling gasoline in the local community. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alexander joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alexander is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teb

texts.en:
Teb P., 66, resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with his wife and their 5 children.

To make a living Teb cuts hair for which he earns approximately US $2 per day. His wife rents part of their house to employees of a local garment factory for which she earns US $2 per day. The family is also assisted by two of their children who are currently employed as nurses. They all help to cover the household expenses.

Teb and his wife seek to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Teb is requesting a loan of US $200 to purchase more supplements to aid his barber shop. This is his second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more supplements to aid his barber shop.

loans.name: Estelle Evelyne Yelian

texts.fr: M. Estelle Evelyne Yelian est née le 09 Février 1987 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Estelle Evelyne Yelian est une célibataire résidant depuis plus d’un an à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou. Estelle Evelyne Yelian vit seule et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Estelle Evelyne Yelian a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a de cela 1 an 6 mois que  Estelle Evelyne Yelian vend du maïs en gros et en détail au marché de Cococodji, afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Estelle Evelyne Yelian s’approvisionne à Azovè et à Dogbo, deux marché de produits vivriers au Bénin. Estelle Evelyne Yelian n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité, Estelle Evelyne Yelian sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
M. Estelle Evelyne Yelian was born on February 9, 1987 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is unmarried and has been residing for over a year in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou. She lives alone and has no children yet. She stopped attending primary school. A year and six months later, she started selling corn wholesale and retail at the Cococodji market in order to support herself. She stocks up in Azovè and in Dogbo, two markets for staple foods in Benin. Estelle Evelyne Yelian has never had an ALIDé before. To augment her working capital and to grow her business, she's requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn

loans.name: Trebol De 4 Hojas Group

texts.es: El Banco Trebol D. 4 Hojas es una D. las bancas que se sostiene en base a sus socias antiguas, las socias D. la banca se dedican a la venta D. celulares, pintores, lavado D. autos, Tienda D. Abarrotes, venta D. verduras, banca que actualmente se encuentra en el 3er ciclo, durante su permanencia no presentaron problemas, siempre cumpliendo sus cuotas. Los creditos otorgados lo invirtieron en la compra D. mercaderia, aumento D. capital en sus negocios, ya que sus negocios llega a ser uno D. los principales sustentos para su familia la mayoria D. las socias tienen recursos economicos bajos que con los creditos otorgados van mejorando su calidad D. vida. ANTONIA, es una D. las socias que conformo la banca trebol D. 4 hojas, es una D. las fundadoras, y representante D. la banca como presidenta, actualmente sigue  como representante D. la banca Comunal, en su permanencia la señora ha aprendio a ser una D. las socias mas ahorradoras dentro su grupo, su actividad es la venta D. flores, velas, en las iglesias, es muy exigente con sus compañeras los creditos. CINTHYA LICETTE, es la secretaria D. la banca Comunal, es una D. las socias que integra a la banca como fundadora, en su permanenecia demostro mucha responsabilidad, en sus pagos D. cuotas, su actividad es la venta D. celulares, el credito solicitado lo necesita para la compra D. mercaderia. ANA, socia que cumple la funcion D. tesorera D. la banca, al igual que otras socias, es una D. las fundadoras D. la banca, la socias se dedica a trabajos con vidrio, el credito lo invertira para la compra D. material D. trabajo, en la banca aprendio a estar en comunidad con las socias siempre puntual, a la hora D. pagar cuotas.
texts.en:
The Trebol D. 4 Hojas Bank is one of the banks that fundamentally supports its older members. Them members of the bank sell cell phones, are painter, wash cars, run a general store, and sell vegetables. This bank is now it its third loan cycle, and during their past cycles there have not been any problems, always making their full payments. The solicited loans will be used for the purchase of merchadise and for building capital for their businesses in order to allow their business to be one of the main financial providers for their families. The majority of the members have low financial resources, and their loans would improve their quality of life. ANTONIA is one of the members of the Trebol D. 4 Hojas Bank, she is one of the founders, and she is serving as the bank representative and president and is continuing to serve as the representative of the Communal bank. During her time with the bank, she has learned to be the highest saving member of her group. Her business is the sale of flowers and candles in churches. She very demanding of her fellow borrowers. CINTHYA LICETTE is the secretary of the Communal Bank. She is one of the members who helped found the bank, and in her tenure, she has shown herself to be very responsible with her repayments. Her business is cell phone sales and she is soliciting this loan to buy merchandise. ANA is the member who serves as the treasurer of the bank. Like the other members, she is a founder of the bank. Her business is working with glass and she will use this loan for working material. As part of this bank, she has learned to work well with her peers and to always be punctual, arriving at the right time for payments.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, material, and tools for working with glass

loans.name: Verjie

texts.en:
Verjie D. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Verjie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Verjie owns & operates in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconuts in the local community. Verjie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Verjie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verjie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Verjie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Verjie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers for coconut groves

loans.name: Ma. Carmen

texts.en:
Ma. Carmen P. (the one who has a short hair and doing manicure) is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Ma. Carmen is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Carmen owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Ma. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ma. Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Ma. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ma. Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros T. is a 53-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Binicuil Kabankalan City Negros Occidental. She earns her living by direct selling personal  & specialty products and RTW (Ready-to-Wear) Clothes.

Milagros and her husband Danilo have 3 children who are between 25 and 33 years old. Two children are already established with their own families. Milagros is quite proud that one of her children now works as a bookkeeper in the Toledo Branch of NWTF-Project Dunggganon in the island of Cebu.

Milaros joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1981 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in direct selling activities and RTW. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000 from her business activities.

Milagros is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her direct selling and RTW, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 7th loan for the amount of Php 17,000, which she intends to use on direct selling and RTW. Milagros is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura works as a beautician and has 16 years of experience in this occupation. She's married with four children. Two of her children are still unemployed. She works from her home where she receives clients in addition to working on a traveling basis.  She is well known in this occupation due to the long time she has been in the field and to her experience and good quality of work. Today, Laura is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase beauty tools and supplies to reinforce her work and increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase beauty tools and supplies

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Madame Aida D. est une femme mariée qui habite a Camberene et est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis octobre 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficie d’un prêt antérieur.  Elle est mère de 4 enfants. Elle est couturière de profession depuis plus de cinq ans et dispose d’un atelier qu’elle gère dans la localité. Sa particularité est qu’elle reçoit beaucoup de commande. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour acheter des tissus et du matériel qui vont lui permettre d’accroitre son activité. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permet de contribuer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida D. is a married woman who lives in Camberene and has been a member of the U-IMCEC of Camberene since October of 2005. She has already benefited from a previous loan. She is the mother of four children. She has been a dressmaker by trade for five years and has a workshop which she manages in the vicinity. She stands out because she is very much in demand. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 FRS to buy fabric and materials which will allow her to grow her business. Increasing her profits will enable her to contribute to daily expenses.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela K. is a widow and she lives in Sevan with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her son lives and works in Russia.

For about eight years Anzhela worked as a brigade-leader, then as a shop assistant, after which she was engaged in cloth trading. Now she is renting a small shop, where she sells food.

Anzhela has been a client of “Nor Horizon” for many years, but this loan is the first to support her new business. With the profits from her business, she provides her family needs. She requests a 1,100,000 AMD loan to increase the confectionery assortment of her shop.

loans.use: To increase the confectionery assortment of her shop

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 50 years old and is married with five children. Her children are doing well in their businesses and family life.

Margret sells bags of charcoal at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo State. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is also happy because, during the rainy season, her sales of charcoal will increase. She hopes to be a major distributor of bags of charcoal in her community in the future.

Margret is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua O. sells vegetables such as garden eggs (eggplant), tomatoes and other seasonal vegetables at Jukwa. She has received senior high education. She is married with four children and her husband is a vegetable farmer. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Afua’s loan will be used to buy more vegetables and other food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Nassibatu

texts.en: Nassibatu J. trades in local gara dye textile materials. She is hardworking and business minded, and has six years experience in the business.   Nassibatu is married to a local carpenter and has four children, all school going. She spends her entire time in business and needs a loan to buy brillion (a textile), ink and dye for processing. She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and open a bank account to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy materials for making and dying textiles

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio C. G. y su esposa son una pareja trabajadora que esta dispuesta en ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una mejora calidad de vida. En esto momento ellos están construyendo pero les falta capital para poner la losa en uno de los cuartos de su vivienda. Para terminar de construir ellos necesitan comprar material y pagar mano de obra para terminar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio C. G. and his wife are a hard-working couple determined to provide their three children with a better quality of life. They are currently building their house but need capital to install concrete pavers in the rooms. To finish building they need to buy materials and supplies and pay labor costs to complete their project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install concrete pavers.

loans.name: Roukiya

texts.en: Madame Roukiya K. lives in her hometown of Lome and has a food stall where she sells rice, oil, and other general items. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She's had this business since 2006. Now, to expand her offerings and continue to satisfy her loyal clientele, she has requested her first microloan from WAGES of 400,000 CFA to purchase rice and oil.

loans.use: To purchase rice and oil

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar K. is a 39-year-old trader who sells fruits and vegetables. He started his business in 2009. Before, he used to work in a bazaar but his rent was higher than in his new place.

Yashar’s profit is 200-300 AZN a month and he trying his best to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose he applied for a 700 AZN loan which he will use to purchase more products to sell. In future, he wishes to be able to open his own food market.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Flor Estela

texts.es: Flor Estela M. D. R. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el pueblo D. Cojutepeque, el cual se encuentra en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 13 años D. edad, el compañero D. Flor resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, razón por la que debe trabajar muy duro para salir adelante junto a sus hijos ya que la ayuda que recibe D. su esposo es poca. Flor se dedica a la venta D. verduras, las cuales comercializa en el mercado D. Cojutepeque, un lugar en el cual esta rodeada D. un gran número D. ventas, y así mismo D. mucha competencia, razón por la que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su puesto en el mercado, ofreciendo mayor cantidad D. verduras, así mismo desea comprar diferentes tipos D. frutas, y D. esta forma poder asegurar más ventas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a lo que hace D. lunes a domingo vendiendo durante todo el día con la esperanza D. poder obtener excelentes ganancias, las cuales sean D. mucha ayuda para su hogar y sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Flor Estela M. D. R. D. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque, which is located in the Cuscatlán department. She lives with her three children, ages 16, 14, and 13 and must work very hard in order to get ahead with her children because husband lives in the United States and she receives only a little support from him. Flor sells vegetables in the Cojutepeque market, an area which is surrounded by other salespeople, so she has lots of competition. She is requesting this loan, so that she can stock her stall to be able to offer a greater variety of vegetables. She would also like to offer different types of fruits and in this way be able to guarantee greater sales. She is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her work seven days a week, selling all day in hopes of obtaining good earnings, which are very helpful to her household and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a married man with seven children.  Three are still in school.  He has been operating a retail shop for five years. He also does farming to supplement his family’s income. 

He has been a member of Faulu Kenya in a group called Maarifa.  The members of the group are accountable for any member who takes out a loan.  In the group, he also gets the opportunity to save his money on a weekly basis. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets.  He hopes to have a decent house in the future. In ten years, he wants to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets

loans.name: Ireme Tukwatanise, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard working and cooperative 36 year-old married father of four children M. Junior, has been operating a goat selling business from I., Ibanda for over four years.  He started up with a small amount of capital from his still existing farming business. 

M. Junior buys goats from the surrounding villages which he slaughters and gets ready for selling to his genuine customers who have supported him this long.  His business has grown to the extent that he has been able to have his children go to school. In a month, Junior says that he makes 160,000 Ugandan shillings.  He also makes some additional income through his side agricultural business where he sells coffee and bananas. His drawback is having only a small stock of goats therefore he would like to use this loan to restock his business and buy more goats for grazing and fattening. His future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O”; La socia está ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Salome; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es divorciada, ella tiene 3 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la artesanía, ella anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo verduras y poco a poco empezó en el negocio de la artesanía; ella necesita el dinero para comprar chullos hechos en lana de oveja, guantes hechos también en lana de ovino y vender al por menor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de guante y chullos (gorras) al por mayor de los proveedores.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Virgen de la O community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sra. Maria Salome. She is 47 years old, divorced, with 3 children. She operates a business selling craft products. She used to make a living selling vegetables but she has built the new business bit by bit. She now needs a loan to buy wholesale stocks of "chullos" (a traditional knitted hat) and gloves, both made from sheep's wool, which she will resell. Sra. Maria is grateful to all of those who are making her dream come true and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of knitted products to resell.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en: Kalsoom is from Vehari, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan known for agricultural. A very caring lady, Kalsoom stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother very well. She is fond of cooking and prepares different types of healthy food for her family to make them healthy. Her husband, A. M., runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. His shop is always filled with kids and elders. Kids buys sweets and drinks and elders buy household items. He has been in this business for the past four years and has made good customers and a good reputation.  Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business to buy more grocery items for his grocery shop. She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive change to her husband’s business and that his income will improve which will help the family's financial condition.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli O. is 20 years old; she lives in Ijevan city with her parents. Nelli is a student of Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch, and at the same time she runs her own hairdressing salon. Before this business, Nelli was engaged in food sales, but in 2009 she changed the type of her business and she hasn't regretted this change. Thanks to income from her new business, she helps her parents to support their family and pays for her education.    

Nelli is asking for a 400,000 AMD loan to buy a hairdryer, furniture, hair dye, hair spray, etc. for her business.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, furniture, hair dye, hairspray, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor D. sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 11 años venD. artículos D. ferretería así como artículos viejos D. fierro, siendo su puesto D. venta, el patio D. su casa, ya que por estar ubicada dentro D. una zona comercial le da mucha ventaja con los ingresos económicos. Los días que más trabajo tiene son los fines D. semana, en donD. sus hijos la ayudan a vender la mercadería, ya que en su mayoría son muy pesados. Es así que sus ventas se han mantenido estable a lo largo D. estos años, ahora lo que anhela es dedicarse a un negocio más ligero como es la venta D.  comida. Es su crédito número 15 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería, así como D. algunos materiales D. construcción para restaurar la parte frontal D. su casa que será su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
