Margarita is 61 years old, and lives with her husband and the youngest of her 6 children in a house they own.  For the past 11 years, she has sold hardware items such as old metal parts.  She sells her merchandise from the patio of her house that, because it is located in a busy commercial zone, is very advantageous for generating income.  Her busiest days are on weekends, during which her children help her sell merchandise since most of it is very heavy.  With this work, her sales have remained stable over these years.  She now wants to dedicate herself to a lighter business, such as selling food. 

This is credit number 15 that she has with MFP, and she is very happy to know she has some financial support.  In addition, she enjoys being part of her cooperative bank because all the members are very responsible and united people.  Likewise, she gives thanks to all the people that might contribute toward this loan for her, as it will be very useful to her in the progress of her business.

She will invest the loan she is requesting into the purchase of merchandise, such as some construction supplies to restore the front part of her house that will be a sales stand.

loans.use: To supply her hardware store, and buy construction materials to improve her sales stand.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. He is married and has no children. Muhammad owns a motorcycle workshop. He fixes motorcycles, replaces parts and provides all related services. The number of motorcycles is increasing in the region, so Muhammad came to FATEN to take out a loan to purchase new tools and necessary parts. Muhammad's workshop is one of the very rare ones in Jabalia. He has a good number of clients and would like to increase them by providing better services. Muhammad appears in the picture here in his workshop.

<u>Important information about this loan:</u>
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit our FAQs.

loans.use: To purchase tools and parts

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Abibatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The twenty-nine-year-old Abibatu is married to a trader and the couple has two children. For over ten years now, she has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock. 

Abibatu and her group members are applying for a loan of SLL 2,200,000.00  to invest in their respective businesses. By investing the loan in their businesses, these entrepreneurs will be able to make more sales, better profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob M. is a resident of Nkubu Town in Central Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for 20 years. He has five farmhands and produces wheat, maize, peas, onions and milk. All these products are sold at the local market. Farming is his only source of income.

Jacob's main challenge is unreliable water. He has requested a loan of 55000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank, which he feels will mitigate this problem a great deal. The tank will be helpful in carrying out irrigation and allowing production in and out of season. He says this all-season production will improve his income and raise his family's living standard. He is glad Juhudi is helping farmers do business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa M. is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Narcisa is married and has 13 children. To make a living, Narcisa owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Narcisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Narcisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Charique

texts.en: Charique D. R. is from the village of Lawis. She is 29 years old. Charique is an individual member of PMPC. Charique is married and has five children. To make a living, Charique operates a beauty salon and is the beautician. Charique has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Charique joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charique is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Charique from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy materials needed for her beauty salon

loans.name: Benson Salaipei

texts.en:
Benson Salaipei P. is 26 years old.  He is married and the father of two children. Benson has been farming for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Benson learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to prepare for his wheat farming, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. Benson hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. Benson is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to prepare for his wheat farming

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  

Gloria has a business of knitting sweaters. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gloria sells her products from home. 

Gloria has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of threads and needles. She also generates additional income through part-time teaching. 

The main business challenges for Gloria include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of thread. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a cottage industry and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

Gloria lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more thread and needles

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is a married woman who lives in Cadiiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses, a cafeteria and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, Eugene, who is 53 years old, buys and sells fish to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have no children. Joe Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joe Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for their business so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. Joe Ann is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 23 años, vive con su madre, es soltero, y junto a su madre trabajan en una granja de pollo, este negocio lo inicio hace varios años la mamá de Juan, crían los pollos y salen a ofrecerlos ya alineados, no tiene un horario fijo para hacer la venta y actualmente necesita capital para invertir y reparar algunas paredes en su vivienda.
Por lo que Solicita un préstamo para comprar pollo, comprar materiales de construcción como arena y cemento, ya que esta inversión le ayudara a continuar en actividad con la granja y de igual manera a mejorara las condiciones actuales de su vivienda.
Las proyecciones de Juan son que su negocio continúe creciendo, conocer más clientes, proveer las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 23 years old, who lives with his mother. He is single and he works alongside his mother in a poultry farm. Juan's mother started this business several years ago, raising poultry and selling the meat. He doesn't have a fixed schedule to make his sales. He needs capital funds to invest and to repair the walls of his house. 

He requests a loan to purchase poultry and to purchase construction materials such as sand and cement. This investment will help him continue with his poultry farm and he will also be able to carry out some maintenance to his house. 

Juan's plans are to keep his business growing, to gain more clients, and to earn enough income to help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is a member of Pastures group in Faulu Kenya.  He does welding for a living.  He has been in the business for the past six years.  He was previously selling chips to earn a living.  In his business, he has employed one person to help him in his tasks.  

Being a married man with four children, he works hard at his business.  He hopes that someday, he will open a metal-fabricating factory.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela se dedica a la venta de envases de vidrios y cuajadas. Tiene más de 20 años que tiene este negocio. Ella dio inicio al negocio gracias a su esposo y un hijo que trabaja con ella, pues ambos han puesto mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en este negocio, Santos atiende muy bien sus negocios, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben de la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo a los clientes que llegan a comprar botellas o cuajadas. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar un encargo de embases que le están realizando.
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela's business is selling glass containers and 'cuajadas' (a compact, cheese-like product).  She has been in the business for more than 20 years.  She started her business with the help of her husband and one of her children who works with her.  They have both put a lot of effort and sacrifice into the business.

Santos works well in her business and her customers know that the products she sells are good quality.  She is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and she is always ready to assist them in their purchases.  Santos considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay serving her customers all day as they come to buy bottles or 'cuajadas'.  She is requesting this loan to buy an order of containers.

loans.use: to buy an order of containers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 29 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa; esta casada con Percy de 33 años y juntos viven en su propia casa con sus 02 queridos hijos, Samir de 08 años y Estela de 05 años de edad. Sonia y su pareja son el pilar de su familia. Ha Sonia desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, posee su propia parcela donde viene cultivando plantas de café y hojas de coca. Viene trabajando 10 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros para las extracciones de los frutos y así avanza con mayor  rapidez en cuanto a  sus cosechas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es recolectar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos y hojas de coca. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantaciones de café por que es una de las plantas que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas de café.
texts.en:
Sonia, 29, a native of the Santa Rosa district, is married to Percy, 33, with whom she lives in their own home with their two beloved children: Samir who is 8, and Estela who is 5. Sonia and her partner are the mainstay of their family. From very early on in her childhood Sonia's parents instilled in her the value of working the fields. She has her own plot where she has been growing coffee plants and coca leaves. She has been working her own land for ten years. During harvest season she hires day laborers to extract the beans and thus proceeds more quickly with the harvest. 

The thing she enjoys most about her work is collecting the beans from the plants as she feels then that the months of arduous work are rewarded by the quality of the beans. She believes that the most difficult aspect is transporting her products from the field to the collection centers located in the city of San Francisco [Peru], a place where better prices are to be had for her beans and coca leaves. The difficulty she has is not having enough income to cover advance payments to the workers who help her with the harvesting. Thus she turns to loans provided by the institution MFP. For now the priority however is to plant more coffee because it is one of the crops with the highest demand at market. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been quite prompt with her payments and expects to be prompt with this one also. She is a responsible member of her communal bank for which she is much appreciated. With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will hire day workers to help her with the coffee harvest.

loans.use: to hire day workers to help her with the coffee harvest.

loans.name: Jiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUITOUGOU, 3 mariées  et 2 célibataires ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois avec NANA D.. 
NANA D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 sacs de charbon de bois et s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins . Le charbon est revendu  en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA  qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The JIGUITOUGOU group has five women members, three are married and two are single, their average age is 30 and have on average 3 children each. They live mostly in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are in their third-round of borrowing with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their client's needs. Their past loans were all properly repaid. This group of women is in the business of selling charcoal.

With the loan, NANA D. plans to purchase 50 bags of charcoal and will purchase the supplies in the neighboring village. The charcoal is then resold to families in the neighborhood to a clientele of both men and women for cash.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 cfa francs which will be used to pay for daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Mahuclo-Lokokoukoumè Group

texts.fr: MAHUCLO-LOKOKOUKOUME est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Honorine. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent le même quartier à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1970 à Sèmè-Podji, Honorine vit depuis environs sept ans à Sèmè-Podji. Honorine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Marcel et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement deux des enfants restent à la charge du couple. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Honorine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Honorine mène comme activité, la vente de plastiques et de beignet de façon secondaire à son domicile. C’est à Cotonou que Honorine s’approvisionne.  Honorine a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité.  Ce prêt permettra certainement à Honorine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mahuclo-Lokokoukoumè is a group made up of four people, the president of which (the woman with her hand raised in the photo) is named Honorine. The group members know one another because they live in the same neighborhood in Lokokoukoumè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. With the intention of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan with Alidé.

Born in Sèmè-Podji in 1970, Honorine has lived in Sèmè-Podji for about seven years. Honorine is married to a mason by the name of Marcel and has three children, all of whom are educated. Only two of the children remain in the couple's care. Honorine lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the different responsibilities of the family. Honorine never went to school.

In order to meet her needs, Honorine runs a business selling plasticware and, secondarily, beignets from her home. Honorine shops for her supplies in Cotonou. Honorine already has two years of experience working in this business. This loan will surely allow Honorine and her group to build up their business through an increased stock of their products, and to expand their client base and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Babi Rahayu Group has received its third loan from MUK. Ni Ketut, as head of the group, obtained a loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah, used to maintain two pigs that will be prepared to be sows. Ni Ketut finds it helpful to supplement family income with this work. She hopes for the future this cooperative will run smoothly. Furthermore, with the present value of pork starting to improve, these loans will be very useful. 

Ni Ketut is in the front row, third from left, wearing brown clothing. Of the total number of members (14), only 13 could be present because there was a religious ceremony.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells food items such as cassava, plantains, "garden eggs" (a kind of eggplant), okra, fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes and other items at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this trade for five years.  She helps her husband to provide the daily needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy fresh tomatoes, onions and other items to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profit into her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh tomatoes, onions and other items to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is 32 years old and married with 2 children, ages 7 months and 2 years. He runs a general merchant store in Grassfield, a neighborhood of Freetown

Abdul has been in this business for 6 years and sells televisions, DVD players and freezers at his store. He also earns income from small-scale farming. He says that the main challenge to his business is price control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electronic appliances. Abdul says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings. In the future, he would like to be a supplier in a different store.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions and DVD players.

loans.name: Beverly Gil

texts.en: Beverly Gil, a 29-year-old married mother of two schoolchildren, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a dried fish business in the Philippines for the last five years. Now requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall,  Beverly Gil would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi tiene 27 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella nació en el distrito de Echarate (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) y  vive en la misma ciudad de Echarate a una hora de la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco). Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que junto con su pareja se dedica a la venta de materiales y herramientas de construcción. Ella atienda la ferretería desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días. Ya es un año que funciona el negocio y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales que le están haciendo falta como pinturas, clavos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Noemi es estudiar la carrera profesional de administración  de empresas y expandir el negocio hacia la ciudad de Quillabamba. (Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Noemí is 27 years old and has a son.  She was born in Echarate District (La Convección, Cusco, Perú) and still lives in the city of Echarate an hour from the city of Quillabamba (La Convección, Cusco).  She is an enterprising, hard working woman who together with her spouse sells building materials and tools.  She tends to the hardware store from 7am until 8pm every day.  The business has been operating for a year now and it’s doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy materials she needs like paint, nails and some other things.  Noemí’s dream is to study Business Administration and to expand the business to the city of Quillabamba.  (Quillabamba is the capital city of La Convección Province and an important commercial hub of the Lares and La Convección valleys.  The main activities are coca leaf, coffee, cocoa bean and fruit production.)

loans.use: to buy building materials and tools.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahí  conocimos la socia Carmen y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 43 años edad, tengo cuatro hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que es el alquiler de cuartos de su domicilio”. 

Carmen se dedica a conseguir personas que desean vender terrenos y después a venderlos a otras y de ahí gana comisiones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el préstamo para revestir su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” holds its meetings every 30 days in the city of Cusco.  It is there that we meet their member Carmen, who tells us:

“I was born in the city of Cusco.  I am 43 years old, have four children, and I live in the same city in which I was born.  It is also there that I have developed my business, which is renting out rooms in my home."

Carmen also makes her living finding people who want to sell land and then selling the land to others.  From that, she earns a commission.  She has been running this business for several years, and, thanks to the effort she puts into her work, it has been going very well for her,.  At this time, Carmen needs the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Mayas De Chopuerta Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana es casada, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 4 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de animales, inició este trabajo  con la crianza de gallinas y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura de maíz.

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de animales domésticos para la compra de cerdos para crianza, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la producción agrícola y al comercio. Espera mejorar su negocio y tener más animales.
texts.en:
Sebastiana, 42, is married.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children four of whom are in school.  She does domestic chores and raises animals.  She started the work raising chickens and to date has four years’ experience.  Her husband helps out farming corn.

She decides to organize a group to request a loan that she’ll use to buy domestic animals, to buy pigs to raise.  The other group members are farmers and merchants.  She hopes to improve the business and have more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gandiimaa

texts.en: Gandiimaa is 52 years old and lives with her two children and husband in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  Her two children are college students.  Her eldest son works in South Korea and pays his own college tuition fees.  Her husband is a carpenter and sells wooden furniture.  Gandiimaa started her business in 1990 by selling goods such as cigars, matches, paper towels, and other similar products at the local market.  She also sells food products that are in high demand.  Her commercial space is located in a very crowded place.  She supplies the products she sells from the province's central town.  Her sales income and profit are good enough to cover the basic running costs.  In the past, she has taken two business loans from XacBank.  She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Sel

texts.en:
Sel, 30 year old, resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a grocery seller at home and earns $5 per day. Her husband is working in a company and earns $4 per day. She has four children; one is studying and the other three are too small for school. 

Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell. This loan will help her family to buy more kinds of goods to sell in her store for her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Banungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Richard is the leader of the community bank named “Banungi Plus,” which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Richard runs a general store in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa. Besides that, he also sells beverages. He has been in business since 1995. Currently, through his businesses, Richard makes about $20 per day. He plans to use his next loan to purchase a freezer in order to sell cool drinks and increase his income. Richard is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having received and properly repaid nine loans. He dreams someday of building a large business facility to keep goods. 
Richard is 39 years old, married and the father of three children aged between 6 and 11. Two of them attend school. Richard enjoys selling because it gives him the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent customers he is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for cool beverages.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia lives in Mombasa town, Kenya. She is married and has one child aged 3 years.  Her child has joined kindergarten. 

Patricia owns a clothes shop that has been in operation for the past 2 years. She began the business in order to provide income for the family. A loan of Ksh 50,000 will help her buy a new stock of clothes.  Her business is located in the heart of Mombasa town and with the high number of customers, she will be able to make high sales. This will in turn improve her family income.

Patricia plans to open other branches of clothes shops in the  future.  Although she faces the challenge of seasonality in her business, she believes that she can achieve much through Milango loans and is happy to be a Milango client.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Joshep Christian

texts.es: El socio no a cambiado de opinión y su vida tampoco a variado en estos meses, el socio Joshep continua trabajando como restaurador de cuadros de la escuela cusqueña, el socio es experto en el arte de recuperar los cuadros antiguos de la época d ela colonia, el socio se desempeña en las distintas tecnicas que relaiza para una perfecta restauracion usando los acabados finos de las antiguas pinturas y liezos, el estudió el arte con sus tecnicas y formas, sus estilos y conocedor de nuestro pasado el socio sigue realizando muchos aportes a nuestra cultura, en esta ocasión el socio sigue en el bacno comunal ya que ellos tiene en conjunto sus ahorros que les ayuda a generar sus propios intereses, el socio en esta ocasión solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de arte que en el mes de diciembre traen los artesanos al pueblo para ser exhividas y venderlas. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de uno o dos cuadros de los artesanos tradicionales.
texts.en:
The member hasn’t changed his opinion nor has his life varied in the last months.  Joshep continues working as a painting restorer in the Cusco school.  He is an expert in recovering old paintings from the colonial period.  He performs the different techniques needed for a perfect restoration using fine finishes of the old paints and canvases.  He studied the techniques and forms of art, its styles and he knows our past.  He contributes much to our culture.  

A this time the member continues with the communal bank because his savings are in an account there and they help him yield some interest.  He is requesting a loan to buy art in December since this is when the artists from the villages bring them for exhibition and sale.  He will use the loan to buy one or two paintings from the traditional artists.

loans.use: to buy one or two paintings from traditional artists

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 44 years old, married to Kindi and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid all her previous loan well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to plant maize and wheat under irrigation in her farm and on large scale.

In future, Maria hopes to have a large plantation of wheat as well as pump water for irrigation into her farm, thereby becoming one of the leading farmers in the region.

loans.use: To plant maize and wheat under irrigation

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in the school. She has a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been running this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.en:
Reymunda is married with four children.  She is 46 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.

Reymunda is a farmer and engages in a backyard piggery business to earn a living.  She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her pig-raising business.

Reymunda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Reymunda hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children between the ages of ten and four months. Both of them go to school. Ibrahim runs a cosmetics store, and he has been in the business for ten years. This business is Ibrahim's only source of income. He has one employee. 

Ibrahim heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done by the company's loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items like Razack oil, Cocodam oil, Carolight oil, and other beauty products.  

In 5 years time, Ibrahim hopes to build or rent a good shop. His major challenges include competitors and a low income rate.

Ibrahim says that he appreciates the support of Finance Sudan and that God should bless the company.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a 32-year-old farmer. He is married and has four children between the ages of three and ten years, the first three of whom are already in school. His pineapple, banana, milk, and tea produce is sold locally.

Kirui has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him add another dairy cow into his farming business. He says the loan will enable him acquire a better and more productive breed than the ones he has currently. He say that the income he generates will go towards education of his children.

Kirui says that animal diseases and lack of funds deter the growth of farmers' businesses significantly, as they are limited in the acreage they farm and do not enjoy economies of scale.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, de 52 años, natural del distrito de Kimbiri es una señora muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo Toribio de 52 años y sus 03 hijos en su casa propia. Virginia, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo educa a sus 03 hijos y solventa en los gastos de familia y los estudiso de ellos.  La bodega de Virginia, es la primera en abrirse en su barrio situado en el distrito de Kimbiri, abre las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y ya están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 14 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela incrementar mercadería para su tienda.  Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Virginia, is 52 years old and from the Kimbiri district.  She is a very hard working woman.  She lives with her husband Toribio, age 52, and their 3 children, in a home they own.  Virginia works a lot and with her hard work she has educated her 3 children, covering household expenses and their education.  

Virginia's store is the first one to open in her neighborhood in the Kimbiri district.  The doors of her business are open starting at 6am, when she's ready to receive the first shoppers, who shop there because they know the variety of merchandise she carries. What she likes best about her job is talking with her customers and learning about what is happening in the neighborhood.  She has had this business for 14 years.  The hardest part of her job is having to be in the store all day, without being able to leave.  Over time, she would like to increase the stock of merchandise in her store.  

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she expects to pay it on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other women in her communal bank.  She is very respected in the communal bank because she brings order to the group.  With these 1,500 new soles, she will purchase additional merchandise to better stock her general store.

loans.use: to purchase additional basic needs products to stock her store.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise, age 57, is married to a farmer. They have 7 children aged between 12 and 31. Two of them attend school. She sells foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum and local drinks. She has requested the loan to add more sorghum and beans for resale. With the profits she will pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for resale.
